Time to use your water vehicle for something it wasn't necessarily meant to do: moving over land. The more meters your traverse, the more points you rack up.

Go back fast!

Small arms range: With rifles, machineguns or sidearms you will be using the small arms range. On this range you will be presented with both static and moving pop-up targets (1 and 2 points respectively). You will also gain a point bonus the further away the target is. A second bonus can be earned by achieving an accuracy rating higher than 85%.

Heavy arms range: Here you are presented with static pop-up targets (1 point), large static targets (1 point) and moving vehicles (2 points). You cannot engage moving vehicles until they have entered the Firing Range's red zone.
At both ranges it is mandatory to remain within the firing area (green zone). This rule does not apply when using aircraft or explosives.
Put your aim to the test on the Firing Range. Hit as many targets as possible!

The inside loop is one of many aerobatic manoeuvres your aircraft can perform. Complete a full inside loop by pulling up the nose of your aircraft and looping back around. Start the loop from level flight.

In the Armory you can view information on all of ArmA 2's equipment and creatures. Select an item from the list and use it in one of three modes.

* Scene - watch a dynamic cutscene
* Viewer - use the item viewer
* Try! - start a tryout session
The item viewer lets you inspect an item up close.

Controls:
- panning
- rotating
- zooming
2x - reset
The cutscene shows the item you selected in action.
The item will be up against enemy units if it is or has weaponry.
You started a tryout session for the item you picked. During this session you will be presented with two types of optional challenges.

Primary: These are bigger and tougher, like defending a location or clearing a mobility range.

Secondary: These are smaller and can even occur during primary challenges.

In the Armory you can view any and all in-game items in great detail. You are also able to complete a series of challenges using the item you selected. A successfully completed challenge earns you points, which in turn will unlock new items.

Primary challenges are bigger and tougher challenges, which you will be asked to accept or decline before they start. Secondary challenges are smaller and they can start at any time. They are fully optional, so it is up to you to evaluate whether you can complete them at the time they are offered!
You can return to the item selection menu at any time by selecting "Back to Armory" in the pause menu.

Let's see how you do with your secondary weapon. Move to the second lane, take the pistol and take down a few targets. Just free shooting, no points.

All right, now come back to me and fall in.

Move forward/backward by pressing %1 / %2, steer by pressing %3 / %4. You can also steer with your mouse.
To look around while driving, hold %1 and move your mouse.
To get out of the vehicle you first have to stop and then select 'Get out' from the Action Menu.
To get in a vehicle approach it and select the 'Get in as ...' action from the Action Menu.
Sometimes it's better to carry your wounded. When dragging select the 'Carry' action from the Action Menu.
Now drop the wounded marine by selecting the 'Drop' action from the Action Menu.
Stand close to the wounded marine and select the 'First Aid' action from the Action Menu.
Walk up to the wounded marine and select the 'Drag' action from the Action Menu.
The waypoint icon shows your goal. The number under it shows its distance. Follow the Waypoint.
To take the gun get close enough to the crate for the Take Weapon icon to appear near the screen center.
Now press %1 to perform the action indicated by the icon. 'Take Weapon' in this case.
Walk using %1,%2,%3,%4 or direction keys.
You may look around and aim using the mouse. Zoom by pressing %1
You now have a chance to demonstrate what you've learned.
Sometimes it is advisable to walk slowly. Hold %1 to Walk or tap %1 twice to toggle Run/Walk mode.
Sometimes it is necessary to crawl. To go prone, press %1.
Stand up again by pressing %1.
Sometimes it is better to use 3rd person view. Press %1 to toggle 1st or 3rd person view.
Reload your gun by pressing %1.
Shoot by pressing %1. Zoom in by pressing %2 and use optics/ironsights by pressing %3.
Change your stance to improve precision - press %1 to go prone, %2 to knee and %3 to stand up.
Go to the ammo crate and perform 'Take magazine' Action using Action Menu

Learn basic movement and interface controls. Go to MSgt Miles, your team commander, arm yourself with a rifle from a nearby crate and fall in.

In the first lane, simply to let off a few trial shots to familiarize yourself with the weapon. This will be followed by a rifle marksmanship test. You will have one magazine for the test, you need to score at least 20 hits to pass and you will have 3 seconds per target. If you score 25 points, you will be awarded the Rifle Marksmanship Badge. You will also have the opportunity to shoot a few rounds with the pistol on this course.

Today we have the training range all to ourselves. You can refresh your basic skills in the training camp. When you're done there you should drive our team's humvee up to the heavy weapons range. There you'll have the chance to try some man-portable anti-tank weapons and take part in a simulated fight for an abandoned village. We recommended you complete the other training sessions before trying out the MOUT (Military Operation in Urban Terrain) course. To end the mission approach Sgt Miles or contact him by radio at any time between courses.

Before going into combat Razor Team members should hone their skills and fitness. An <marker name="course1">obstacle course</marker>, <marker name="course2">firing range</marker>, <marker name="course3">first-aid course</marker>, <marker name="course4">driving practice</marker>, anti-tank weaponry <marker name="course5">shooting range</marker> and <marker name="course6">MOUT range</marker> are all available to you. Get your briefing from MSgt Miles in the training camp. Listen to his advice and practice according to his instruction.
01: Basic Training
Training Plan
Wounded
TAKE WEAPON
SGT MILES
DRIVE HERE
TAKE PISTOL
FIRING POSITION
You're clear to HALO jump in special operations. Great job, Marine!
You're clear for parachute insertion in combat jumps. Good job, Marine.
You did not land close enough to designated landing zone. Try again before going to battle.
You crashed into the ground. Next time, don't forget to open your parachute at an altitude no less than 100 meters.
TRAINING ACCOMPLISHED.
TRY AGAIN!

You will take part in some refreshment training for High-Altitude-Low-Opening (HALO) jump techniques. Everyone's objective is to hit the designated landing zone as precisely as possible. You will be inserted at 1000 meters approximately 1 km from the objective. You should free-fall towards the objective, then open your parachute at an altitude between 300 and 100 meters. The LZ is indicated by a white cross; ground staff will pop green smoke nearby to aid identification. You must land within a 20 meter radius of the objective. To achieve the Naval Parachutist Badge, land no more than 6 meters from the objective. After the first jump, you may retry or end the mission by talking to the officer at the LZ or via radio.
Sorry sir, the crosswind caught me off guard. Let me try again.
I think I've had enough, sir. We can end this training session.
Sir, I think I landed a bit further out than expected...
Coops, even O'Hara did better than that! I strongly recommend you try another jump.
Yes sir, you bet. I think I can do better next time.
I think I've had enough, sir. We can end this training session.
Not bad, Coops, wanna try again?
Yes sir, you bet. I think i can do better next time.
I think I've had enough, sir. We can end this training session.
Copy Captain, I can hear you, over.
Battlemage to Razor 2, do you read? Over.
Do, do I hear water splashing, Coops? Oh my. I'm sending the boat for you, hold on. Do you want to try and hit something solid for a change?
Yes sir, with pleasure!
I think I've had enough, sir. We can end this training session.
Copy that, thanks Captain.
Hey Coops, that was a great landing, outstanding!
You wanna go again Coops?
Hey relax Eight-Ball, we have done this before...
You need to land precisely on the LZ. Free-fall towards it, when you see it wait a while then open your chute, you know the drill.
Yeah, but you still suck at it. Captain Shaftoe's waiting down there, so try to make me look good, OK?
Chute checked, good to go here buddy.
Get ready, thirty seconds to objective.
Check the chute.
Copy that, prepare to jump. Green light in 3 - 2 - 1, go!

You will take part in some refreshment training for High-Altitude-Low-Opening (HALO) jump techniques. Everyone's objective is to hit the designated landing zone as precisely as possible. You will be inserted at 1000 meters approximately 1 km from the objective. You should free-fall towards the objective, then open your parachute at an altitude between 300 and 100 meters. The LZ is indicated by a white cross; ground staff will pop green smoke nearby to aid identification. You must land within a 50 meter radius of the objective. To achieve the Naval Parachutist Badge, land no more than 6 meters from the objective. After the first jump, you may retry or end the mission by talking to the officer at the LZ or via radio.

Freefall towards your objective and watch your altitude. Open your parachute at about 100 meters altitude and steer it towards the landing zone. Green smoke will help you find it. Land no further than 20m from the center of cross-shaped marker.

Learn the basics of parachute jumping.

You will take part in some refreshment training for High-Altitude-Low-Opening (HALO) jump techniques. From the <marker name="start">MV-22 Osprey</marker>, you will be inserted at 1000m altitude and approximately 1km from the objective. Free-fall towards the objective, openening your parachute at an altitude between 300 and 100 meters. The <marker name="LZ">Landing Zone</marker> is indicated by a white cross; ground staff will pop green smoke nearby to aid identification. You must land within a 50 meter radius of the objective. After landing, visit Cpt Shaftoe in the <marker name="camp">judges camp</marker> for evaluation.
02: Parachute Jump
Training Plan
Enjoy it while you can, asshole. OK, mount up.
There are some more targets to the west. Let's go.
I think I can handle bossing you around some more Sir.
Copy that, sergeant. You're dismissed.
Hey, I think I've had enough for today, Sir.
Hello sergeant. Cooper, is it?
Today you can familiarize yourself with armored vehicles - the M1 Abrams in this case.
Excellent. Now, sabot rounds are great against heavily-armored targets, but for APC's or clusters of infantry you'll want to use high explosive shells. Reload them now.
Once you're done with reloading, destroy that group of targets to the left.
Effective isn't it? OK, now it's time for you to try the commander's seat.
Don't you get too comfortable up there, hear me?
Time to familiarize yourself with control of the whole tank. Order your driver to move to the next Waypoint.
OK, now target the fake tank there and give the order to fire.
Good job. Let's stretch our legs a bit, everyone out!
That's it. This covers the basics of armor training but as you know it's never this easy in the field. But remember what you've learned today and it may save your life.
You had enough or do you want to practice some more?
Let's get on with it, shall we? Take the driver's seat. I'll be the commander for now and Cpl. Jones here will be the gunner.
Follow the waypoints and get us to the base. We'll get ready for the gunnery course there.
If you're a bit claustrophobic you can open the hatch and 'turn out'. I wouldn't recommend doing that in combat though - unless you want some skull ventilation that is.
Here we are. Now I want you to position the tank next to each of those support vehicles. They'll replenish our fuel and ammo reserves and take care of repairs as well.
Good. Now we'll switch places. Cooper, move to the gunner's seat.
There. OK sergeant, use the machine gun to destroy those targets ahead.
Good job. Now, get us to the beach.
There are some armored targets in front of us. Use the main cannon to destroy them.
Yes, Sir.
To get in, get close to either side of the tank and use the Action Menu.
Switch the engine on or off via the Action Menu. Any throttle input will also turn the engine on.
To zoom in for a closer look at distant objects, use %1.
To switch between the main cannon and fixed MG, press %1.
To switch between the main cannon and fixed MG, press %1.
Types of ammo can be switched via the Action Menu.
Order the driver with the movement keys or use commander view, %1, and click on a destination with the mouse.
Assign targets to the gunner with %1 and %2.
Order gunner to fire by pressing %1 when target is assigned.
To move forward, press %1. To move slowly press %2 and for fastest speed press %3. Release the key to come to a stop.
To drive backwards, press %1. Release the key to come to a stop.
To turn out, press %1 or use the Action Menu.
To turn back in, press %1 or use the Action Menu.
To toggle between first and 3rd person view, use %1.
To move the weapon, use the mouse.
To fire, press %1.
Why march into battle when you can drive? It's the American Way!

As part of your refreshment training, today you will have the chance to experience the life of a tanker. First you will attempt to manoeuvre the M1 Abrams around the training polygon, then man the gunnery position and neutralize a few practice targets. When you complete this stage you will be given command of the entire vehicle and learn to issue basic movement and fire orders. The first part of your training session will be concluded by familiarization with basic maintenance procedures. In the second phase the vehicle will be placed under your command and you will be able to train freely on the armor range. Training can be terminated at any time between courses by contacting an instructor.
03: Armor
Training failed
I give up. I think I prefer walking... or maybe flying...
Court martial
Maggot! You're not worthy of the corps! I'm putting you up on a charge!
Training accomplished
I made it! I'm qualified and on my way to more advanced training!

Learning to handle the tanks available to the Corps is vital to your on-going training. You may find yourself more comfortable behind the wheel than on foot. Today you'll try everything from tank driver and gunner to tank commanding.
Continue
Finish tutorial
Get in tank
Get in the Abrams tank. Use the 'Get in' action from your action menu.
Refit the tank
Make sure your tank is properly supplied before field training begins. You may refuel at the supply trucks or at a vehicle supply point.
Destroy infantry targets

Suppress and eliminate enemy infantry with the coaxial machinegun. You may also use the main gun with high-explosive fragmentation ammunition against light targets such as infantry or unarmored vehicles.
Destroy armor targets
Destroy armored targets with the main gun. Use sabot armor-piercing ammunition against armored targets or heavily fortified enemy structures.
Command the tank
Take command of the vehicle. Order the driver to move to a designated position. Once there, assign a target to the gunner and order him to destroy it.
Free training

You're still in command of the vehicle. Feel free to try any position and expend some ammo on targets in the training area. You may refit your vehicle any time at the vehicle supply point. Return the tank to the base and disembark or contact your instructor to finish your training session.
That's affirmative, Sir, ready and waiting. Out.
Sergeant?
I sure hope you do, Sir!
Yeah hopefully, Sir. Everyone out!
This is where we unload the squad. OK, like last time - nice and slow.
Good job. Let them out.
OK that's it. Take us home.
Third time's a charm. You're getting better at this landing thing, aren't you?
There we go! Bet your momma would be proud.
So, what now?
The Venom, then. Very well, let's go. Hop in the pilot's seat.
OK start her up and follow the Waypoints. There's a patrol waiting for us not far from here.
And please, don't get us both killed, OK?
OK, contact on our guys. They've popped green smoke.
Bring the chopper to a halt and try hovering for a while, then slowly descend and land.
This is Star Force 21 to Bridgekeeper, you guys ready down there?
There, nicely done. Let them get in.
OK, that's all of them. Get us to the next waypoint, Coops.
Eh, feel like transporting some troops.
Hey there. Don't worry, I'm getting the hang of this.
See you guys in the field.
Hey, I thought you were my mother?
Ooh Rah! I heard that. The Cobra's all yours. I'll be the gunner.
Start the engines and climb to 20 meters.
OK now follow the waypoints to the range. Try flying no higher than 30 meters. This will help you avoid detection by most radar.
Don't overdo it though. Consider safety your top priority.
OK this is the shooting range.
Show me a nice fly-by. Switch to unguided rockets and destroy those targets.
Nice havoc there, Coops!
There goes the last rocket. Not really a sharpshooter, are you?
Let's try the machine gun now. I wanna have some fun too.
There is an automated moving target on the road. Lock it and give the fire order.
That's it, we're empty. You get a bit carried away huh?
Great job. Another hunk of metal goes to hell.
Now for some real fun, guided missiles.
Same drill again - lock the target, tell me to fire and the rocket will do all the work.
Excellent. Now back to base.
That was our last rocket. These things are pretty expensive, you know?
Nice example of air superiority, wasn't it?
Want to go on?
Let's blow some shit up!
Feeling lucky today eh, Coops? No problem, let's get that Seahawk airborne.
OK. Listen very carefully now. Soon, the engines will lose power and you'll start descending.
When that happens, I want you to keep the nose down, just as you would on an attack run, then decrease the thrust fast.
OK, get ready.
Now!
Congratulations Coops, you got it! Pretty intense eh?
I'll just say... Try again.
So, what about that emergency landing?
Why not. I've had enough lecturing you anyway.
Jesus Christ! I'll beat the shit out of you if I die here, I swear!
What the fuck are you doing?! I'm reporting this to command. You're gonna be hip deep in shit!
Cooper, where exactly are we going? Get us back to the island.
Your choice, pal.
Sure, whatever. Come again if you want.
I think I'd better grab some chow or something. Wanna join me?
Huh, I think I've have enough of this. I'm going back to base.
Hey Maddox, could we call it a day now? I've had enough.
Hey Coops. Let's let's take another look at flight controls.
So, what will it be?
War looks better from altitude. After this training, you'll want to stay airborne forever.

Today you'll learn basic flight controls, perform a squad extraction and take part in a combat air patrol. The advanced training will include operating a fully equipped AH-1Z and a chance to demonstrate your piloting skills on the NOE course. Last but not least, you will learn how to save a disabled chopper with Auto Rotation.

Fly to designated extraction area. The grunts on the ground will pop the green smoke to mark the landing zone. Land there and wait till they embark the chopper and fly them to the insertion area. After you land there and troops get out, you will return to base. Try to land as close to the helipad as possible.
Gunship

Follow the waypoints until you get to a suitable position for fire. Follow the instructor's orders and engage static targets marked on your HUD. Destroying at least one of two targets for each weapon system is required to pass the training. After attacking all 3 groups, you need to return to base and land at the helipad.
Emergency landing

Learn to land safely on the ground after a simulated engine failure. When the engine stops working, push the collective backwards in order to decrease the speed by pressing %1, and decrease the collective power by pressing %2.
Maddox, this is Cooper. Good to hear you buddy. I've been looking forward to this.
Utes Tower, this is Boomer 1
Utes Tower, Boomer 1, ready for taxi, VTOL practice flight.
Cleared for taxi and take-off runway zero niner, Boomer 1.
Maddox, this is Cooper, thanks for your help. She's quite an aircraft.

Cooper this is Maddox on UHF, coming in loud and clear. I'll be your instructor for today. I know you're pretty familiar with jets but today you're gonna get some time in our VTOL aircraft, so you need to pay attention. Go through your start ups and get clearance from the tower, I'll get back to you after.

Ok Cooper, Maddox again. You're looking great, when you're ready, engage the VTOL flight mode and extend the flaps fully. Increase thrust slightly and try to hover the aircraft just a couple meters above the runway. If it starts to slide out, just easy the stick gently in the opposite direction and until she's stable. Make small, light adjustments.
Looks good, Coops! OK let's get moving. Ease the nose down and increase power slightly. Head to the next waypoint on your HUD. No rush, you got a full tank and we got plenty of time.
That was fine. Now, gain some speed and altitude, increase thrust and raise your landing gear.
Good job, Cooper. You're safely above the aircraft's stall speed. Disengage VTOL and retract the flaps now. Now follow the circles.
Copy that, enjoy yourself Cooper and don't break anything! I'll be back to help you with the landing on approach.
Boomer 1, Utes Tower, go ahead.
Boomer one, Utes Tower, you are cleared to taxi and take-off runway zero niner, QNH 1013, wind calm, east departure.
Utes Tower, this is Boomer 1, request full stop landing clearance at Utes airport.
Cleared to land, runway zero niner, Boomer 1.
OK, Boomer 1, you are cleared to Utes airport, runway zero niner. You are number one on final, cleared to land.
Utes Tower, Boomer 1, approaching Khe Sahn carrier.
Khe Sanh Tower, this is Boomer 1, approaching, request landing clearance.
Khe Sanh, this is Boomer 1, cleared to land, weather information received.
Khe Sahn, Boomer 1, on blocks.
Boomer 1, this is Khe Sanh, you are cleared to land. We have wind gusts between 3 and 10 knots from 030, approach southwest recommended, ship velocity is zero.
Welcome home, Boomer 1. Khe Sahn out.
Roger Boomer 1, contact Khe Sanh tower, frequency change approved.
Boomer one, this is Utes Tower, please state your destination. You bringing that bird back to Utes airport or will you proceed to the USS Khe Sahn carrier for a VTOL landing?
Utes Tower this is Boomer 1. Approaching runway zero niner, request landing clearance.
Roger, right base, cleared for landing, runway zero niner, Boomer 1.

Me again Coops, let's get her down. Slow to 300, extend flaps and keep decelerating until you're at 200 kph. Align the nose with the runway center line and lower your gear. Don't try landing at speeds higher than 250 kph. If you can't get your speed down, abort the landing, gain speed and altitude and go around for another attempt.
Having too much fun up there huh Coops? If you don't feel like landing yourself you can always activate the landing autopilot, which should get you down safely.
Boomer 1, Utes Tower. The airport is at your 9 o'clock, two miles. Turn right base to runway zero niner. You are cleared for landing, no traffic on runway.
Utes Tower, this is Boomer 1, on ground. Request take-off clearance, practice flight again.
Cleared to taxi and align runway zero niner, Boomer 1.
Cleared for take-off, runway zero niner, Boomer One.
Once again, Cooper. You know the drill: flaps down, full throttle. At about 150kph ease back on the stick and wait. She'll start climbing.
OK Coops, you're airborne. Raise the gear, retract the flaps, gain some speed and altitude.
Boomer 1, Utes Tower, you are cleared to taxi and align runway zero niner.
Boomer 1, you are cleared for take-off, QNH 1013, wind calm.
Copy that, fire at will. Boomer 1 out.
Maddox this is Boomer 1, all air and ground targets destroyed.
Maddox this is Boomer 1, I'm out of ammo, returning to base, over.
Boomer 1, this is Maddox. You should see some practice targets out there. You are clear to engage targets now. Fire at will.
Nice shooting Boomer 1, proceed to the next waypoint.
Better luck next time, Boomer 1, Maddox out.

Sir, no sir!

Air superiority wins wars. Master the sky and the battlefield will fall into place.

Today you have chance to try out F-35, Navy's most advanced jet at hand. First phase of the training flight will comprise of VTOL flight mode familiarization, followed by basic circle around Utes island and landing. Your plane will be armed and you will continue with simulated combat sortie against ground and air targets. To accomplish combat training, you need to destroy one ground target and air target. You will be free to choose where to end your flight: either on Utes airfield or on USS Khe Sanh LHD.
05: Fixed-wing / VTOL
VTOL flight

Go through basic Vertical Take-Off and Landing (VTOL) routines. Fly carefully and slowly, steer using the rudder controls. Follow the waypoints and in the end, increase your horizontal speed and switch to normal flight mode when indicated.
Circle and land

After activating normal flight mode, follow the pre-planned route and land on the airfield from west. When on approach, put the flaps fully down (two times) and decrease your speed below 200 km/h. Don't forget to release your gear. You may also use landing autopilot for landing. Decrease your speed below 40 kph to accomplish the landing.
Take-off

After landing, taxi around the runway and position yourself on indicated take-off position, facing east. Flaps should be half-retracted for start. Accelerate and gently pull nose upwards. When in the air, retract your gear and flaps and accelerate to reach at least 500 km/h.
Ground attack
Get to starting point and prepare to engage ground targets, represented by few wooden tank mock-ups. Use any available weapon system to destroy at least one target.
Air attack
Get to starting point and observe target passing. Lock it and attack with a rocket or hit it with your cannon. You need to down the target to accomplish this part of training.
Land on LHD
Return to LHD, land on main deck in VTOL mode and turn of your engine to end the training flight.
Return to base
Return to base, land, taxi off the runway and turn of your engine to end the training flight.
Learn how to lead you squad.

Today you’ll practice commanding subordinates. You'll learn to issue move and boarding orders and how to assign targets to you teammates. You'll familiarize yourself with helpful Quick Commands and also learn how to issue complex orders to your group.
You are now fully prepared to lead you squad into battle.
Welcome to the Commander tutorial. \nIn this training, you will learn how to issue orders to your subordinates in combat.

Apart from Quick Commands you can also issue more specific orders from the Complex Command menu. Its different sections can be accessed by pressing numbers 0 - 9, the main menu is displayed after pressing %1.

Press 1 to open the Move menu.

1: %1
The Move menu is used for more complex movement orders. You can set formation here, stop the unit or manage waypoints.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 2 for the next menu.

2: %1
This menu contains a list of all currently available targets that can be assigned to selected units.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 3 to open the next menu.

3: %1
The engage menu sets the combat behavior of the selected unit. You may prohibit fire, allow units to engage at will or have the unit control their surroundings.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 4 to open the next menu.

4: %1
This menu contains a list of all nearby vehicles the selected unit can board.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 5 to open the next menu.

5: %1
The Status menu is used to report your status. As leader you can also ask subordinates about their status via 'Report Status'.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 6 to open the next menu.

6: %1
Here you'll find a list of actions for the selected unit. These display the actions you would have in your Action Menu if you were that unit.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 7 to open the next menu.

7: %1
You can control unit's behavior from this menu. You can switch to Safe or Combat states and set a unit's combat stance.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 8 to open the next menu.

8: %1
You can control group formation from this menu.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 9 to open the next menu.

9: %1
This menu allows you to divide the group into smaller teams. This is useful for controlling multiple units.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 0 to open the next menu.
Your subordinates are listed in the Command Bar on the bottom of the screen. You are also listed there, usually in the first slot.

0: %1
All radio communication is found in this section.

Wait for Sykes to arrive at his destination.

You can manually select small groups of subordinates for commands. Keys F1 to F10 correspond to units on the Command Bar at the bottom of your screen. Keys F11 and F12 are used to cycle through units if there are more than 10 in your group.

Select Rodriguez by pressing F3.

Order Rodriguez to enter the HMMWV Sykes is in.

* Click on the vehicle in the map ('Get in HMMWV' must be selected)
* Complex Command > Mount

In many cases you will be able to switch directly to your subordinate units via the Team Switch function. Activate it via the 'Switch to...' item in the Quick Command Menu (only when a single unit is selected) or by selecting the unit in the list that appears after pressing %2.

Switch to Sykes.
Return to base. The green icon indicates your leader's position.

After switching to back to the commander, subordinates remain where you left them until they receive new orders. Thus you can position team members to cover you, other teams or directions.

Switch back to Cooper via the 'Switch back to leader' action or by pressing %1 and selecting him form the list.

In order achieve the best possible control over your team you have Commander View at your disposal. Enter it by pressing %1.

Activate Commander View.

In many missions, your command allows you to use a chopper as a fast transport.

As leader, select position for extraction by:
%1 >
%2 >
%3 >
%4

Order the whole team to board the chopper.
The whole group can be selected by pressing %1.

All aboard, you may now select the destination - USS Khe Sanh.

Click LMB on the ship while holding the Alt key.

The easiest way to command is via the Quick Command menu. Open it now by pressing %1.

Open the Quick Command menu.

Menu contents change depending on what you're aiming at, your teammates and your status.

Move Sykes close to you by selecting 'Move there' while aiming at a point close to you.

If your teammates become separated on different tasks, you may order them to return to formation by selecting 'Regroup'.

Order Sykes to return to formation.

You can also issue individual orders to all units in the group. Press %1 and click on a target (a point to move to, enemy, vehicle, etc.) as soon as the cursor changes. The cursor shape gives you a clue as to what order you'll issue.

Order Sykes to enter the HMMWV in front of you.
Do not hold %1, just press it and then click on the HMMWV.

If necessary, you may also command troops on the map.
Turn the map on by pressing %1.

Commanding on the map works just like commanding in normal view. Select all units by pressing %1 and click on the map to issue a command. Commands are context sensitive to the cursor.

Send Sykes to pick up Rodriguez in the supply depot to the north.
Base Queens
Supply Depot
Barracks
06: Team
Learn how to command a whole army.

Today you’ll learn how to command. Not one group but several groups of different units types at once. Learn how to be a General! The training takes place near the village of <marker name="kamenyy">Kamenyy</marker>, where an <marker name="HQ">improvised HQ post</marker> has been built.
Now you are ready to command an army.

Welcome to the High Command tutorial.
You will learn how to command multiple groups in large scale manoeuvres. Not one, but several teams of various unit types at once.

Let's get started.,

Basic Controls
Alongside Quick Commands you can also issue more specific orders using the Complex Command menu. Its different sections can be accessed by pressing numbers 0 - 9, the main menu is displayed after pressing %1.

Press 1 to open the Move menu.

Complex Command
1: %1
The Move menu is used for more complex movement orders. You can skip waypoints here or even cancel them.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 2 for the Target menu.

Complex Command
2: %1
This menu contains a list of all currently available targets that can be assigned to selected groups.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 3 to open the Engage menu.

Complex Command
3: %1
The Engage menu sets the combat behavior of the selected group.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 4 to open the Speed menu.

Complex Command
4: %1
Using this menu you can set the speed of selected groups. The available speeds are: Limited, Normal or Full.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 5 to open the Mission menu.

Complex Command
5: %1
In some scenarios (like Warfare), you can assign available missions to selected groups.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 6 to open the Action menu.

Complex Command
6: %1
The Action menu is used for customized actions which can be specific to each mission. This menu can often be empty if there are no custom actions in the mission.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 7 to open the Combat mode menu.

Complex Command
7: %1
You can control group behavior from this menu. You can switch between Safe or Combat states.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 8 to open the Formation menu.

Complex Command
8: %1
You can control group formation from this menu.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 9 to open the Team menu.

Complex Command
9: %1
This menu allows you to divide the group into smaller teams. This is useful for controlling multiple units.

Close the menu by pressing %2 and press 0 to open the SITREP.
The Command Bar at the bottom of the screen is for commanding units within your group. To command multiple groups, switch to the High Command Bar by pressing %1.

Complex Command
0: %1
SITuation REPort will provide complex information about all selected groups, e.g number of soldiers and vehicles.

Map Controls
Commanding in 1st person view is quick and convenient but the map screen provides a far better overview of the combat situation.

Display the Map by pressing %1.

Map Controls
In addition to using the F keys or Quick Command menu you can select groups in the map by clicking on them. Select the tank group.

To select:
* Click %1 on the group symbol
* Press F3.

Map Controls
To cancel the selection click %1 anywhere on the map (not on a group), or use the F key that corresponds to the group (F1-F10).

Cancel group selection.

Map Controls
You can also select multiple groups in the Map. Hold the left mouse button and drag to select multiple groups.

Select both groups.

Map Controls
This is possible too, but please, try a different selection method.
Hold the left mouse button and drag to select multiple groups.

Select both groups.

Map Controls
Move both Groups to the marked position.
Place a Waypoint by clicking %1 on the desired location.

Map Controls
You can place several Waypoints in a row. Hold Ctrl when placing a Waypoint to add additional points thereafter instead of replacing the original.
Create at least three Waypoints in a row.

Map Controls
It's also possible to open the Waypoint Properties menu by %1 on a Waypoint.
Open the Waypoint properties menu.

Map Controls
You can set the same type of orders for a Waypoint as you can for a group. The orders will be executed when the group reaches that Waypoint. The Waypoint can be canceled by selecting 'Cancel Waypoint'.
Cancel a Waypoint.
The Command bar has now switched to the High Command Bar, displaying units as NATO symbols. These tell you about the side, type and size of a group.

3D/Map Controls
Eventually you'll learn how to attack. NATO symbols are used for detected enemy units too. You may order your groups to attack these.
Destroy enemy chopper.

To initiate an attack of a selected Group:
* Click %1 on enemy Group
* Select enemy Group from the Target List (Complex Command > Targets)

This is all you need to know to control units via High Command. Practice and you'll be ready to command your men in any conflict.

You can exit the mission when ready by selecting 'Exit' in the radio (press 0-0-1).

The shape and color represents which side the group belongs to.

%1
BLUFOR (USMC, CDF)
%2
OPFOR (Russia, ChDKZ)
%3
Independents (NAPA)
%4
Civilians
Side

The icon in the middle of each frame represents unit type e.g. infantry, tanks, helicopters etc. A list of the most common symbols follows:

%4 Armor
%1 Infantry
%2 Motorized infantry
%3 Mechanized infantry (Infantry + Armor)
%5 Helicopters
%6 Airplanes
%7 Headquarters (HQ)
类型

Finally there is a cluster of small icons above the unit symbol that represent the size of the group. The following numbers and names may vary with different unit types.

%1 Fireteam
%2 Section (> 4)
%3 Squad (> 12)
%4 Platoon (> 25)
%5 Company (> 60)
Size

Basic Controls
The easiest way to command is via the Quick Command menu. Open it now by pressing %1.

Open the Quick Command menu.

Basic Controls
Menu contents change depending on what you're aiming at, your groups and your status. You can select or deselect single groups to issue more specific orders.

Move all the groups close to the MTVR in town by selecting 'Move there' while aiming near the truck.

Basic Controls
You can manually select certain subordinate groups to command. Keys F1 to F10 correspond to units on the Command Bar at the bottom of your screen. Keys F11 and F12 are used to cycle through groups if there are more than 10 under your command.

Select the Infantry group by pressing F2.
07: High Command
Learn how to build your own base.

When deploying in an amphibious assault, it is vital to build a bridgehead base on the shore quickly. On this course you'll learn how to build a base and about the functions of the various buildings available. Remember the base is vital in any large-scale scenario.
You know now, how to create your base.
<t color='#B6F862'>Open the Construction Menu</t> by selecting an Action from the Action Menu.

This is all you need to know to build the base.
Press %1 while in category menu to close the interface.

Now you can practice base building without any limits.

To return to the main menu, perform the 'End Mission' action from the Action Menu..

You may test camera controls:

Change angle: Move mouse
Forward/backward: %1/%2
Left/right: %3/%4
Up/down: %5/%6

The gray wall limits your camera movement.

You can see a building category list in a menu to the left. Please, select 'Base'.

Select an item: %1/%2
Confirm item: %3

This is a list of buildings. Each building has a description and a price.
Items are grayed out if you do not have enough resources. The amount of resources available to you can be seen in the bottom left corner.
Select one of the buildings.

Select an item: %1/%2
Confirm item: %3

Now you see a Building Preview. The color indicates whether or not it can be built in that location:
Green - Possible to build
Red – Impossible to build
Gray – Cannot build outside base perimeter

Find a suitable spot.

You can rotate the Building Preview by pressing Ctrl and moving the mouse.
Holding Alt while rotating the Building Preview rotates the building in predefined angles.

Place your building.
Great, the building is ready. Now you'll learn how to repair it when it gets damaged.

Boom ...
To repair the building hover the cursor over it to reveal its description and status. Then press %1.

Shiny. To complete your training you have to know how to sell buildings.
Hover the cursor over the building as before and then press %1.
08: Construction
Landing Zone
Good afternoon Marines!
Welcome to Operation Harvest Red. Just a few miles to the north lies the small country of Chernarus.
Tomorrow morning you will step from your landing craft and do what marines were born to do! They, on the other hand, will wish they'd picked a country without a shoreline...
Settle down. Now, it's going to be hard to distinguish between enemy, ally and civilian.
You sandy-cracked boys should be used to that by now but I want to make one thing very, very clear:
Shoot a civilian during my Operation and I'll have you courtmartialled before the barrel has cooled, understood?
Tonight our Recon teams will pave the road for the major offensive.
The next few days will be intense, gentlemen. Good luck.
We are up against the well-armed insurgency called the 'Chedaki.' These are the guys responsible for the attempted coup in September.
Their aim was to turn "South Zagorie" into a separate state within Chernarus. They want revenge for the previous civil war.
As you know, they made short work of the Chernarusian Defence Force. They slaughtered government officials and took a lot of ground.
Now some of you where involved in the recapture of Utes a few days ago, so you know what these Chedaki did to the local garrison.
Home to around 3,000,000 native Chernarussians and some 800,000 ethnic Russian settlers. They are not the best of friends...
Some of the things we found in the hangar, the barn in Kameny, the armor base, those guys in the church - well it doesn't bear thinking about. But don't forget what you've seen.
To those of you who watch more cartoons than AAN this may come as news, but thankfully you're not all like me.
Gentlemen we are going to war!
Politicians will call this a 'peacekeeping operation' but make no mistake we have a clear enemy.
In the weeks ahead you will face both seasoned guerilla fighters and highly trained regulars. Men who know this land.
And they won't give up the fight just because the world has suddenly taken interest in their little domestic.
But you, Gentlemen, you are United States Marines.
You have been to Afghanistan. Most of you still have sand in your butt-cracks from Iraq and these Chedaki will not present you with a challenge!
Semper Fi!
****TO TRANSLATE****
Hell no! Semper Fi! Ooo-Rah!
Yeah! Ooh-Rah! Woo!
Well Patrick, you and your men better follow me. We've got work to do.
Sir.
Marines, dismissed!

Hey that's you Coops...
Well, that was a newsflash... And I thought we were here for a weekend break...
Sorry, I was daydreaming. At least those guys fought to the end...
You bet, Master Sergeant!
Definitely. Just leave some Cherna chicks for us, Coops.
Yeah, with the stuff we have, bad guys should be gone in an hour after landing.
Show 'em, Coops.
Nice to see you, Sarge.
Getting ready?
Combat?

Why?
Really? Why's that?

Na, I got stuff to do. Catch you later.
Oh yeah! Man you should see it! Eighteen acres of sweet, sweet...
Sure, they won't mind. So, tell me about that new house of yours bro!

Hey can't talk now, you better not keep Shaftoe waiting.

Ice Cold! How's it going?
Robo! You eat a baby or something? You get any bigger dude I 'ain't gonna let you on my bird!

Shaftoe tells me I've got the pleasure of your company for the flight in.
So I hear. Only a few hours now huh? You nervous? I'm shitting it. Wanna hang here and shoot the breeze some? Your team cool with that?
God not you too... Jesus! What's up Maddox?
I'll eat you man! What's up?
Maddox. You heard anything juicy?
Is that right?
Sorry, just daydreamed. Must have been hard for the guys in church... But hey fought to the end.
Wake up Coops! Jeez, pay attention, man.
Why send a team? Can't we just cruise missile the thing or something?
We need men on the ground to visually confirm the stations coordinates. Then comes the airstrike.
Who do I have to my left and to my right, Sir?
Other Force Recon Marines will be operating in the area but the rest of the MEU won't land until you complete your mission. You're on your own for this one Razor.
The Chernarussian Defence Force are our allies in this conflict.
Logistically they're pretty cut off at the moment.
But once we open up a supply route in the north-eastern Zelenogorsk they will become a very capable fighting force.
Who are these CDF, Sir?
Insertion will be via Venom chopper just before dawn tomorrow.

I'll need you to stay in the field once your objectives are complete. I may need recon for secondary ops. The bulk of the USMC landings won't happen until shortly after dawn. I may call on you for spotter duties then.
What happens after we complete, Sir? Extraction?
The ChDKZ are a mix of insurgent militiamen and rebel Chernarussian army regulars.
They are mostly well trained, well armed soldiers, not farmers. You'll be up against aging but effective arms and armor

For you, Razor, that means neutralizing a key radio installation just outside the village of Pusta in the early hours of tomorrow morning. We think it coordinates enemy coastal defenses.

After chopper insertion by Star Force 21 north of your target, you will reconnoiter the outskirts of the village, find out exactly where the comm center is and broadcast its position to Hazard 3 who will execute an air strike. You will then provide BDA, withdraw and stand by for orders.
Gentlemen make no mistake; this conflict has the potential to destabilize the entire ex-Soviet bloc. We need to intervene now to prevent this crisis escalating any further.

An estimated 12,000 strong force of the Chernarus Red Star Movement - the 'Chedaki' as the locals call 'em - have seized control of key areas all over north-eastern Chernarus. Take a look at the photo here, note the star symbol.

Check out this group. The guy in the middle is 'Akula' Lopotev. Means 'Shark'. Along with his henchmen here, they terrorise and torture Chernarussian civilians. If you happen to meet them, report the contact immediately. We want those men alive if possible.
What's left of the loyalist Chernarussian Defence Force is holed up in Zelenogorsk and its surroundings. If we don't step in now there may not be anyone left to help.
Operation 'Harvest Red' will retake key areas and re-establish CDF control. Force Recon - yourselves included - will lead the attack ahead of the Battalion Landing Team.

The briefing will start once the whole team is inside.

USEUCOM has finally approved the deployment of a Marine Expeditionary Unit to Chernarus. The 27th MEU is en route, baby! We're going in! Hell, yesterday I didn't even know Chernarus existed and tomorrow I'll be fighting for her. Soon as I found out where we were headed I did some research on the internet. It's one of those tiny, half-forgotten nation states rolling around in eastern Europe, what's left of the old Soviet bloc. They've been squabbling over the scraps since the early nineties but the last two years were a rare period of peace. Some semi-democratic corrupt government (who's isn't?) got elected and that calmed things down for a while. But there's been something of a communist uprising recently. This summer, large numbers of separatist guerrillas clashed with the government forces (the Chernarussian Defence Force), and now there are parts of the country not under central control. That's why we're here. Re-establish government order, kick some ass, save the day. If nothing else, it makes a change from the sand!

Aboard the USS Khe Sanh the 27th MEU are 50 miles off the southern coast of Chernarus. An irregular force of volunteer partisans under the political banner of the ChDKZ - The Chernarussian Red Star Movement - or 'Chedaki' to the locals, have seized control of large parts of the north eastern province. Information leaking out of the country suggests high civilian casualties in these areas. The region lies on top of an ethnic fault line of Chernarussian nationals and Russian settlers left over from the soviet era. Although recognized by Russia, the Kremlin has already snubbed the ChDKZ by refusing to absorb the break away region into the Federation. The Russians don't want to get involved, and so we must.

Flawless Victory

Razor Team performed exceptionally well. They destroyed not only the ChDKZ communication node in Pusta, but also took on secondary objectives at Pik Kozlova (designated ChDKZ targets during the invasion). If every unit in the Corps were like Razor Team, the war would be over already. Outstanding.
胜利

Razor managed to destroy the ChDKZ communication node. ChDKZ communications were successfully disrupted and thus enemy reinforcement assignment, unit allocation and logistics are all inhibited. The destruction of the node also reduces the impact disinformation and propaganda has on the populace in this area. Good job.
Defeat

You failed to destroy the ChDKZ communication node in time. Until the node is neutralized the ChDKZ can organize a prohibitively robust defense and broadcast disinformation to the local populace. The invasion cannot proceed. You have failed miserably.
Killed in action
A member of Razor Team was Killed In Action. This is an unacceptable loss for such a small Recon team. The unit is now Combat Ineffective. Mission immediately canceled, Razor Team extracted.

Razor Team performed perfectly. They destroyed not only the ChDKZ communication node in Pusta, but also took on secondary objectives at Pik Kozlova (designated ChDKZ targets during the invasion) and rescued some local civilians. If every unit in the Corps were like Razor Team, the war would be over already. Outstanding.

Tonight's the night.
The first mission of a new Op. Nothing like that feeling, mixes your guts up real good. The Red Star Movement (ChDKZ) know we're out here - it's kinda hard to miss a WASP class carrier sitting off the coast - but they don't know exactly what we'll do just yet. I guess they're still hoping it's a show of force. But this dog's got bite!
Hopefully they'll put up a bit of a fight all the same. Hate getting all wound up only to see 'em fall over their AK's trying to surrender... They seem to have handled themselves OK until now, but then they've only had a bunch of girl-scout Chernarussian Defence Force to deal with.
The legitimate government army didn't exactly shine during the 'September crisis'. Life's about to get a whole-lot tougher for those poor ChDKZ bastards. We're coming to get you boys! Hope you brought some spare undies! Here's a photo I found on the internet.

Fierce looking, but I'm sure they'll run like hell when they see us.

Mission Plan

The 27th MEU is ready to make land.
Force Recon element 'Razor Team' will attack and disable a key communication station prior to the main MEU assault.
The comm's installation is a primary communication node for the ChDKZ in this region. They're also using it to broadcast disinformation and propaganda. Razor Team will insert, attain visual confirmation and eliminate the target by airstrike.
The village of Pusta and the surrounding countryside are under ChDKZ control but we do not anticipate elite units or serious hardware here. This should be a piece of cake.
Go to the exfiltration point
EXFIL
Get the exact coordinates of the communication center in Pusta and send this data to Hazard. They will drop the bombs. Regroup at point Liquid.
Direct the airstrike
From your insertion point continue to point Keyhole near the village of Pusta. After reaching it, perform a recon sweep of the village and get visual confirmation of the ChDKZ communication node.
Leave Pusta and continue south to point Liquid. Regroup with your squad there.
Regroup at point Liquid
REGROUP
Send it in.
I want some more action!
I'd like to quit.

Before elements of the 27th MEU land at 0600, an important communications node in the <marker name="BIS_pustaPos">village of Pusta</marker> must be destroyed. If successful, the mission will disrupt OPFOR communications; vital for a smooth invasion.

Razor Team will be inserted via UH1Y, callsign 'Star Force 21' to an <marker name="BIS_LZ">LZ</marker> near Pusta. Razor Team will then move to <marker name="BIS_pointKeyhole">point Keyhole</marker> to coordinate the strike. After the target is destroyed, Razor Team will regroup at <marker name="BIS_pointLiquid">point Liquid</marker> and proceed to <marker name="BIS_pointMadison">point Madison</marker> for extraction by Star Force 21.

Razor Team is to locate the target in or around <marker name="BIS_pustaPos">Pusta village</marker>. After confirming the location, Razor will report this to the command element (callsign 'Battlemage'), who will then order CAS to destroy the target.

The village of Pusta is lightly guarded by several ChDKZ (Chedaki) insurgents. The enemy is not expecting us, but more OPFOR could arrive if Razor are detected. Patrols may be encountered in the areas around the target location.
Insertion and extraction via UH-1Y Venom callsign 'Star Force 21'. The target will be destroyed by two tactical bombers, callsign 'Hazard' via CAS request.

Reaper One, be advised reinforcements inbound, callsign Razor Team. Hold your position and await your relief, over.
After the beachhead, the Chedaki parted like a Thai hooker's thighs. Armstrong's creaming his khakis.
Most of the GCE rolled right over the second line right up to here. We're on the outskirts of Cherno' right now. That's also why your still here, boys.
Sorry guys, I need every infantry unit I can lay my hands on for the assault on the city.
You got it Miles.
All right that's enough Marine, I know you're tired but keep it together, copy?
Master Sergeant, you're with me. We need to brief you on the next phase for Razor.
In the mean time I'm sending your team into Cherno to reinforce our foothold, you can rendezvous with them later, OK?
Reaper One this is Swordsman, go ahead over.
Well it wasn't pretty Sir, I can tell you that. Op was silky though.
No Sir, it makes sense. Nail the place down while they're on the run. Last thing we want is prolonged siege of the capital, right?
Copy that Captain. You guys go on ahead, I'll see you there.
Cooper this is Miles, don't get my team killed, go get some Marines!
I'm sorry Sir, what?
Well come on, let's go!
Oh man...
Ah great, MOUT for breakfast... And on such a good night's sleep too...
Sir!

Fuckin' ay.

Yes Sir, don't need to ask that, sir.
Yes Sir!

All right, now listen up. Lopotev could be nearly anywhere by now. You'll have to decide where to start looking yourselves. Visit some villages, grill the locals, check with intelligence, do whatever you need.
When you're ready go and find Captain Dressler, he's with intelligence over in Elektrozavodsk. He may have other information that could help you on your way.
Cooper, you're being field-promoted to team leader for the duration, don't let me down. I'll leave it up to you to decide how and where to begin your search for Lopotev.
I'm assigning Star Force 21 to your command, Maddox's Venom is at your disposal from now on. You also have access to UAV terminal next to command post.
I think that just about covers it. Dismissed... and get some.
Things are still messed up on the ground. If you're not flying I recommend you take a vehicle from the motorpool.
All right, I expected nothing less. Truth be told I hated to ask, but there it is...
Now, I have a condition. I want your word, Marines, that you're here for the right reasons.
This can't be about Miles. You're here for the Chernarussians, not for revenge, understood?
You're wrong there Coops, I do need to ask. Especially as I'm sending you after Lopotev, you're Recon after all, it's what you do.
I figured giving the mission to Sabre or one of the other Recon teams would piss you off so it's yours. They wouldn't like taking it from you anyhow I'm sure. But don't make me regret it, clear?
Yes Sir!
Sir!
All right Coops, Sir!
Copy that Captain.
All right Sir!
Ooh Rah!
Electric Zaphod what?
Sir.
Sir!

OK. Well, I guess that's understandable. OK pack your gear guys, you're out of here. I'll send someone from logistics within the hour, dismissed!
Well, thank you Sir, it's appreciated.
Hello Razor Team, stand easy. I wanted to come over personally and say how sorry I am about what happened with Miles.
I know you were a tight team and Pat's gonna be a hard man to replace, that's why I'm giving you a choice.
I can stand Razor team down for the duration, you can go home get some R and R, we can get you on a Fat Albert tonight and you'd be in Germany for dinner...
Settle down. Now, you've done your bit, it's been a tough twenty four hours and you've done everything asked of you.
No one expects a deep Recon unit like Razor to function well one man down, let alone your team leader. So, what's gonna be?
No, Sir that's not necessary...
What?
Razor, this is Swordsman, an allied unit has taken care of the sniper. You missed your window. Out.
Oh shit! Damn, I don't think we should've done that!
Yes, they didn't look like they were picking berries. Don't worry, they're all gone. I see you were preparing for the attack too!
Yeh, I hear some good things about you NAPA types...
Don't panic, I'm not here to hunt guerillas! You're safe from me.
I'm looking for Chedaki high-command. Lopotev, Bardak...
Yeh, I share that feeling. They could be anywhere, Chernarus is a big country and it's all Chedaki in the north.
What do you mean?
What are you getting at Olegich?
Huh. Thanks Olegich, I'll bear that in mind.
So long Olegich.
Did you meet the Chedaki in the forest? They wanted to attack the village! We've heard the shooting...
There are many passionate fighters in Chernarus. We are not all like the CDF.
My pleasure Sergeant. Thank you for your help. Good luck with your hunt.
Ah... Huh... Hmm... About that...
Ah! That's good to hear my friend. I thought... well, never mind. So why are you here?
Bastards, both. Good luck finding them. Their kind hide in the dark like beetles.
Well yes, but have you thought about looking under you noses?
Before the war, Lopotev and his party were popular with the working man. The party began life among the workers of the factories and quarries.
In the south the ChDKZ would hold huge rallies around the big worksite.
Well, maybe they've gone back to their roots. The power plant in Elktrozavodsk was used during the uprising as a headquarters for organizing the rioting.
Maybe you've been looking so hard at the north you've missed a link right under your nose.
Cease fire!
Outstanding work everyone, good job.
So long Olegich.
Glad to hear that, but you help as too.
Yeh, I hear something about NAPA heroes...
Don't panic, I'm not here to hunt guerillas! You're safe from me.
I'm looking for Chedaki high-command. Lopotev, Bardak...
Yeah, I share that feeling. They could be anywhere, Chernarus is a big country and it's all Chedaki in the north.
What do you mean?
What are you getting at Olegich?
Thanks Olegich, I'll bear that in mind.
Looks like we got them all!
Thanks, you marines are amazing!
Maybe you've been looking so hard at the north you've missed a link right under your nose.
My pleasure Sergeant. Thank you for your help. Good luck with your hunt.
There are many passionate fighters in Chernarus. We are not all like the CDF.
Ah... Huh... Hmm... About that...
Ah! That's good to hear my friend. I thought... well, never mind. So why are you here?
Bastards, both. Good luck finding them. Their kind hide in the dark like beetles.
Well yes, but have you thought about looking under you noses?
Before the war, Lopotev and his party were popular with the working man. The party began life among the workers of the factories and quarries.
In the south the ChDKZ would hold huge rallies around the big worksite.
Well, maybe they've gone back to their roots. The power plant in Elktrozavodsk was used during the uprising as a headquarters for organising the rioting.
No! Not here! Go fight somewhere else! Go away!
No! You want to shoot people! You want to smash out my windows and take potting shots at passing Chedaki.
I know what you do. I heard about Chernogorsk. You think I want my country to end up like the Middle East?
No, you can turn around and go away.
But there's no need! There aren't any Chedaki here, not when I am on duty! Not for sure.
Franta! My friend Franta in Solnichniy call me that he saw some ChDKZ vehicles driving in there this morning. Look there!
Look. OK. I know I can't stop you but you're wasting your time here. You'll just make me look bad and you'd be better off just searching Solnichniy I'm sure.... But do what you wish...
Sir, we just need to look around...
Sir, we have to search this area for hiding Chedaki combatants. You can either help or hinder but we are going to look around.
Well thanks, maybe we'll do that too. Now stand aside.
Tell me about these camps again.
I've marked three areas on your map. Head on up there when you're ready, but be advised it's still a combat zone.
Could we call Star Force 21 now, sir?
Sure, you can call the Huey any time you need it. Just call Maddox and give him coordinates for a Landing Zone.
Who's this Lieutenant anyway?
Lieutenant Tomas Marny. He's with the CDF, seconded to my intelligence unit. He's here in the camp somewhere.
Lopotev mentioned Vyshnoye before he executed Miles, know anything about that?
Hmm, Vyshnoye is a village north west of here. I don't have much intel connecting it to Lopotev but maybe you should check there too.
OK... OK, we've got everything we need, thanks sir.
No problem Razor team, glad I could help. Good hunting.
Hello sir, thank you sir.
Yes sir, the Captain said you might have some information for us?
Yes sir, I would.
Hello Razor team. I heard about Master Sergeant Miles, I'm sorry.
Anyway, it's good to see you boys still in the fight. I hear Shaftoe's let you loose on Lopotev's trail? Assigned you a chauffeur too I hear.
Yep, right there. That's where I'd start my search, gentlemen. I'm not saying Lopotev's definitely in one of these camps, but it's not a bad guess.
OK, any questions?
Indeed I do Sergeant. Now as you know we're working pretty closely with the native Chernarussian Defence Force on this.
I've had one of their intelligence officers seconded to my unit, Lieutenant Marny.
This guy is one of the best field intelligence types CDF counterintelligence has.
He has some useful contacts among local, and maybe among guerillas as well. If you don't screw it up, Lieutenant Marny may share something.
Definitelly check out what he can offer, he's in the CDF liaison outpost here in the base. Look for CDF tent and Chernarussian flag.
Anyway, to business. Hand me your map. I'm marking three areas where the sats and UAVs have seen increased activity since Lopotev's escape. Maybe he's holed up in one of them.
We have these places down as old training camps and barracks, but there could be more to it.
As you can see they're all well inside Chedaki-held territory now but deep Recon boys like you should be used to that.
We wouldn't have lost Lopotev if that bastard Nikitin hadn't been just a damn traitor!
Whatever. You won't find The Shark easily if he wants to stay hidden.
Where's Lopotev likely to go now?
Well he has some camps and supporters between Stary Sobor and Shakhovka, he might head there.
Can you tell me more about Lopotev? Some background might help us work out where he'd run.
I can give you some profiles we have on the ChDKZ leadership. Lopotev's bio's in there, maybe that will help.
Thanks, anything else that might help?
Well, an hour ago, I've had a vague report of Lopotev being spotted in a blue car. It's not much to go on but it might be useful.
Other than that you could try talking to a man named Olegich in Staroye.
Who's Olegich? What's the link?
Olegich is NAPA, a partisan fighter. One of our contacts.
NAPA may have information we aren't party to. As I say he lives in Staroye.
Lieutenant, is that the best the CDF can offer us?
Watch your arrogance, Sergeant. I still outrank you, CDF or not.
I think I've heard everything I need from you, Sir.
Fine. If you find him, I hope he won't run away this time.
Hello Sir? Lieutenant Marny?
I'm Sergeant Cooper, Sir, Force Recon Razor. Captain Dressler suggested we buzz you for information on Lopotev.
Yes, I am Lieutenant Marny, what do you want... Sergeant?
Hah, we wouldn't have to find him if you Americans hadn't lost him in the first place. What do you want to know?
Yeh, I got it down.
OK, it's all yours.
No, not really.
OK man, no problem, it's very simple, I'll explain.
I need to use the UAV.
Yup, here you go.
Do you have permission from Shaftoe?
OK great, do you know how to use the UAV?
Patch?
There's still fighting going on all over, the road isn't safe, we're going another route, don't worry my friends!
Woah, where'd you learn to drive buddy? Easy on those sharp turns, we've got prisoners back here.
Why'd we turn off there anyway? Hey! Hey driver, what's the deal?
Huh, OK whatever you say Patch...
Yeh you know, guy's called Nikitin... ah come on... Nikitin, nicotine... Ah forget it.
Hello, we're looking for Chedaki. Did you see anything strange lately?
Malek, who's that?
Know nothing you understand? Leave me be.
Well, I saw some suspicious cars coming from the shore, men with guns. Do you understand?
Yeah, try to ask Pepa, he's slacking out all the time and sees everything. He's near the water pump.
I didn't see anything. Go away.
Some soldiers were here this morning, so we hid. I do not know anything more.
I saw just some ChDKZ cars coming from the south this morning, that's all I know.
They stopped at Malek's farm this morning.
Malek has a farm just south of here, he's had them up there, the Chedaki, ask anyone here. He's a snake! That's all I'll say about it.
Ask Pepa, he's near the pump. I know nothing.
Flawless Victory

Razor team managed to find Bardak, Lopotev's second in command. The original plan was to capture Lopotev but he seems to have disappeared. The capture of Bardak is a success nonetheless. When the invasion is over Bardak will be brought to trial for his war crimes. It is therefore vital to collect as much evidence as possible.
胜利

Razor team managed to find Bardak, Lopotev's second in command, but he resisted arrest and was killed. The original plan was to capture him along with Lopotev, but we failed to do either. Lopotev has disappeared and capturing Bardak would have been preferable so he could stand trial. A dangerous political leader can be just as bad as a martyr.
Defeat

Razor team was unable to capture Lopotev. He managed to escape and cross the border into Russia. We can be fairly sure the that Russians will deny harbouring this wanted criminal. We have lost an important figurehead for trial and a dangerous ChDKZ leader.
Killed in action
One of Razor Team was Killed In Action. This is an unacceptable loss for such a small Recon team. The unit is now Combat Ineffective. Mission immediately canceled, Razor Team extracted.
Razor Quit

The death of Razor's Team Leader Pat Miles has severely shaken their morale and compromised their ability to make sound judgments. Razor have voluntarily withdrawn for the Area of Operations pending psych evaluation.
HINT: Go and speak to Capt. Dressler in Elektrozavodsk for intel on Lopotev.
HINT: Ltn. Marny is also based with the MCIA in Elektrozavodsk. He should be nearby.
HINT: Pick a more reasonable location

You have been tasked with eliminating a sniper. The shooter is keeping Reaper 1 (rifle squad) pinned at the border of the city. Kill the sniper. As you get close to Reaper 1, they'll relay the sniper's position.
Kill the sniper
REAPER
SNIPER

USMC and CDF units are at the outskirts of the province's capital city, Chernogorsk. The ChDKZ hold the city with allied units attacking from the east and north (USMC) and from the west (CDF). Join the attack on the city.
Assist in the siege
CHERNOGORSK

Well we made it through last night, though I can't say it was the best night of my life. We saw some shit in Pusta that's gonna stay with me for a long time. Still, the operation was a success. With the comms tower down the invasion went well and now we've rolled right up to the capital, Chernogorsk. The Chedaki have mostly pulled back to the interior in the north but there's still a sizeable force holding the city. On top of that the Chedaki brass are apparently holed up inside, including that bastard Lopotev, the guy who ordered all that shit in Pusta. Man I hope I get a closer meeting with him... We've also RV'd with the native army now, the Chernarussian Defence Force, let's see how they stack up when we attack the city.
Mission Plan

The USMC performed a successful amphibious invasion of Chernarus. The ChDKZ resistance was quickly eliminated and the USMC rendezvoused with the Chernarussian Defense Force (CDF). Together they push the ''Chedaki'' inland to the north. However some elite Chedaki forces - Grupa Chernogorsk – together with the key insurgent leaders Lopotev, Bardak and Kostey have fallen back to the provincial capital of Chernogorsk and are digging in. Allied forces are now set to attack Chernogorsk. Razor have been deployed to perform SpecOp missions.

Though ChDKZ rule in Chernarus was short they managed to rack up plenty of warcrimes. Now they'll try to hide any evidence of these atrocities. Your task is to have your eyes open and find as much evidence for ChDKZ warcrimes as possible. This evidence will also help raise popular support for the invasion.
Find evidence
Harvest Red
The ChDKZ are on the run. A siege on the capital Chernogorsk has begun. Razor will join the fight to take down some high value targets.
Answer us asshole!
Please cooperate
Do you want to jail?
Tell me or I kill you!
We'll stay.
Fine, lt's leave.

The invasion was a success. The 27th MEU have rendezvoused with the relieved forces of the Chernarussian government - the Chernarussian Defence Force (CDF). Together the alliance has retaken much of the coast and is currently besieging <marker name="BIS_chernoPos">Chernogorsk</marker> - the capital city of the province. Razor is to assist in the siege.
Meet Cpt. Shaftoe in the field command area.
Razor Team arrived with the siege already in progress. As a special operative team you will be briefed directly by Cpt. Shaftoe.

Elite 'Chedaki' forces have assumed defensive positions in the <marker name="BIS_chernoPos">city</marker>. Senior leaders of the ChDKZ movement are present. USMC elements are to attack from the <marker name="BIS_USMCAttack">NE</marker> while the CDF will advance from the <marker name="BIS_CDFAttack">SW</marker>, surrounding the Chedaki forces within the city.

No support available at this point.
Command element codename 'Battlemage'.
Later that day, on the outskirts of Chernogorsk
Lopotev is a ChDKZ warlord and supposed war criminal. Intelligence says he's in a warehouse with some of his most loyal soldiers.

LOPOTEV
Lopotev, Kostey and Bardak are to be transported to the FOB near Elektrozavodsk. Escort the CDF truck transporting the POW's.
Transfer captives
TRANSFER

Lopotev has escaped the CDF but worse than that he killed Miles. Your mission is to find him. He'll most likely die resisting arrest - you can never forget he killed Miles. Lopotev is probably hiding somewhere in the Electrozavodsk area. Find as many clues as possible and investigate them.
Find & capture Lopotev

Bardak is Lopotev's second in command. He has escaped from CDF custody. Your mission is to find him. He's probably hiding somewhere in the Electrozavodsk area with Lopotev. Find as many clues as possible and investigate them.
