The ChDKZ (Chedaki) warlords Andry 'Akula' Lopotev, Mikola Bardak and Kostey (known only by his alias) escaped CDF/USMC custody following CDF officer Nikola Nikitin's betrayal. Responsible for the death USMC MSgt Miles they are currently at large in Chernarus, possibly trying to leave the country. They must be found and brought to trial by any means. Their escape is an affront to both the USMC and the CDF.

Razor Team should use intelligence resources to uncover possible hideouts which may be used by the fugitives. Some Intel will be provided by MCIA officer Cpt. Dressler and CDF Intel officer Ltn. Marny. Every lead should be followed, including information obtained from civilians during the mission.

The prisoners must be recaptured. They must not be allowed to leave the country. Razor Team must discover the location of their hideouts or find and block the route the fleeing prisoners are using to escape.

The 'Chedaki' are being pushed from the coast into the region north of the Staroye - Vyshnoye line.Stary and Novy Sobor are in 'Chedaki' hands. Although the OPFOR are fleeing, resistance is expected north of the Staroye - Vyshnoye line.
This line is expected to move further northwest as the allies push on.

Command Element – Callsign: 'Battlemage'.
Logistical Support (on demand) – 1x UH-1Y flight. Callsign: 'Star Force 21' and 1x AAV-7A1 APC.
Intelligence Support - 1x Unmanned Aerial Vehicle. Terminal located at FOB Reforger.
Moments later at FOB Reforger...

Name:
Andrey Lopotev aka 'Akula' ('Shark' or 'The Shark')

Date/Place of Birth
July 24th 1965, Solnichniy, Chernarus (then CSSR).

Position:
Leader and co-founder of the The Chernarussian Red Star Movement (ChDKZ).

Background:
In 1997 Lopotev formed the 'Working Man's Defence Alliance' pseudo-union along with other employees of the Solnichniy Quarry Corporation. In 1999 he organized a participated in a violent protest over pay and conditions that lead to at least three deaths, unconfirmed injuries (figures vary from 10s to 100s) and a dozen prosecutions. Later he formed the ChDKZ along with several previous members of the Working Man's Defence Alliance. The party's main line is that of reintegration with the Russian Federation. The attempted coup (see September Crisis) and failed reunification talks with Moscow have left 'The Shark' and his party politically isolated in recent months despite official recognition of their political and military wings by the Kremlin (if not the western world).

Name:
MikolaBardak

Date/Place of Birth
September 3rd 1969, Solnichniy, Chernarus (then CSSR).

Position:
Shadow Justice Secretary and co-founder of the The Chernarussian Red Star Movement (ChDKZ).

Background:
Although officially Shadow Justice Secretary for the ChDKZ Bardak is more commonly known as the head of 'Sotnya Syem' (Group Seven), the ChDKZ secret police organization. A former Solnichniy Quarry Corporation employee Bardak was one of the original members of Andrey Lopotev's 'Working Man's Defence Alliance' naturally becoming a powerful figure in the party after his release from prison following the riots of 1999. On the surface Bardak is cosmopolitan, seen as far more of a 'statesman' than Lopotev, even among the party loyalists. He is well-traveled and educated and is often seen as a more 'rational' and viable leader than 'The Shark' by those fortunate enough not to be familiar with his Group Seven activities.

Name:
Kostey (real name unknown)

Date/Place of Birth
December 12th 1974, Tulga, Chernarus (then CSSR).

Position:
Key figure in the paramilitary wing of The Chernarussian Red Star Movement (ChDKZ).

Background:
Kostey was a small time criminal and poacher who served a manslaughter sentence for shooting and killing a game keeper in the late 90's. During his time in prison Kostey fell in with Mikola Bardak and upon release became a member of the then-burgeoning ChDKZ movement. Quickly establishing himself as a quick and unscrupulous fighter Kostey was fundamental in the growth and organisation of the early muscle behind Lopotev's party. More than a simple thug, Kostey is widely acknowledged to be an intelligent and able leader of men. This is not to say the self-styled 'General' is a stable man, far from it, Kostey is extremely unpredictable though fiercely loyal to his ChDKZ masters.
ChDKZ Leader Bios
Take Dogtags
Take Mapcase
Take Notebook
Take Photos
Fuck you all!
Move away, Americans!
Imperialist swines! Leave us alone!
Die!
Thanks man.
No worries, thanks again.
This is it guys, this is your stop.
No problem, take her easy out there Razor, it's rough country up here.
Go see Cpl. Smith out on the gate, he'll fill you in from here. Catch you later.
Swordsman this is Razor, what's going on Captain? Over.
Uh, say again Swordsman I don't recognize callsign 'Red Square'. Over.
Holy shit.
Razor this is Swordsman, there's been a... development, over.
Razor, someone's bombed Red Square. Over.
No. Cooper. Moscow. St. Basil's Cathedral and the square itself.
No organization's claimed responsibility yet but Dressler and the MCIA guys are betting on NAPA.
I gotta say that it rings true for me. The press are already throwing the name around along with the usual suspects.
If you can get to a TV or a computer or something you'll see for yourselves. The media are going ape shit.
Dressler thinks the Russians will want in on Chernarus now. As far as I know USEUCOM haven't confirmed anything to that effect with Battlemage but it seems likely.
I just wanted to keep you guys informed.
Watch yourselves out there Razor. It could get complicated. Swordsman out.
Thanks Sir, fill us in.
Sounds that way, Sir.
You bet your ass.
Very well. FOB Manhattan has been established to help the CDF quell the local unrest in this area.
The whole area is riddled with militia groups.
The disintegrating ChDKZ remnants are reverting back to their old pre-war 'Sotnya' structures.
That's basically large bands of warlord-led guerilla fighters who know this place like the back of their hand.
But the area of operation's main problem is that these ChDKZ remnants aren't alone. There are other rival militias contesting the turf.

Plus you gotta remember the local population is divided along ethnic lines. There're Russian settlers sympathetic to some militia groups and native Chernarussians friendly to the groups that want the Russians out.
It's a real mess.
No thanks Sir, I'll take a look at the file now.
Outstanding, you've saved me some time Marine.
Now let's get down to brass tacks. I've got a pretty diverse set of objectives for you while you're at Manhattan Razor Team.
The first order of the day is find as many ChDKZ camps as you can within the area of operation and eliminate them by any means possible.
We know these Chedaki Sotnya groups are using several sentry camps and there's undoubtedly a larger base camp somewhere too.
There are also some more delicate things I need a Recon team like Razor to take care of.

There're two possible Chedaki contacts I want picked up for questioning: a guy called Lev Nikolayev and a woman called Antonia Lagushina, details are in the docs. Plus we have reports of weapon caches in Gorka and gun-runners smuggling more arms into the area.
I need the caches checked and the smugglers brought down.
Check your log for more details on these items.
You're cleared to make use of our 81mm mortar battery and UAV terminal. Armory's also at your disposal.
Don't be afraid to call in a fire mission if you need it but for God's sake don't get civilian blood on your hands.
That's about all I have to say to you gentlemen for now. Go and digest those files and get to work when you're ready. Dismissed.
Feel free to use the vehicles we have here, the LAV's near the gate.
Thanks Captain.
Ah Razor, good to see you up here. Welcome to Manhattan Marines, at ease.
Here's some additional documentation for you to look over.
Want me to give you the gist of it or will you read it yourself?
Uh yeah, me too Captain.
Yes sir, right here.
You really think one set of documents will change anything sir?
Copy that.
What about us Sir?
Razor! You're here then. Do you have the documents?
Oh, amazing!
Hey Razor, you're here. Outstanding. Glad you made it through OK.
Do you have Lopotev's op-order?
Well I'll be damned... Unbelievable. Dressler's gonna flip when he sees this.
He's on his way up from Elektrozavodsk. Should be here any time now.
Ah hell, who knows Cooper? They don't pay me enough to worry about that.
Dressler seems to think it might stall the Reds for a while. The last thing we need is the Russian army running around in the woods with us, right?
You bet your ass...
Right here Dressler.
Razor you should return to your objectives. You're doing some fine work out there, but we can't ease the pressure now.
We'll keep you updated on the Russian situation. For now just carry on marines. Dismissed.
To hell with Bardak, it's Lopotev I'm after.
Yeh I know, I know. I'm just still not used to being this responsible you know? Like, all of a sudden it's my fault if things go wrong.
Yeh I guess. Thanks Scarlet.
Sure Robo, I wake up to your mug every day.
You love it.
Hey it wasn't your fault, even if Miles had still been around Bardak could have got away. Don't take it personally Coops.
Randy's right Coops, you're Team Leader now, you gotta keep focused.
Yeah but they didn't, right? With you in command we got Bardak, you should feel good.
You run out of lube again?
ETA three minutes.
LZ in sight, standby Razor.
Man I ain't never going to forget the look on that guy's face. You know that look guys get when they've filled their shorts?
You wish...
I can't believe we let that bastard Bardak get away. Really chafes my ass.
Fuck off Scarlet. I'm not in the mood.
I'm serious though man, that Bardak guy must have been sitting in his own shit all the way back to base.
Big fucking girl.
Fuckin' ay.
You'd be crapping yourself too Rodriguez. After what that guy did, the Chernarussians'll hang him for sure.
It's not about that any more Cooper. Lopotev's gone. You can't bring Miles back by catching Lopotev. We're just here to do our job, man. Let it go.
Hey calm down Robo, he's just fooling around. We're all pissed about Bardak.
Hey they're special forces yes? Rambo!
Who's that?
Halt! Who go there? Friend or Foe?
Advance and be recognized!
Hi. Hey look at you! You are mess! You look like some vagabond militias! Not smart, USMC, Sir-yes-sir boys!
You leaving the AO if you go through here, understand? You got transfer papers? Can't let you through without papers, sorry Rambo!
Friend. US M.C. 27th MEU, Force Recon Razor.
Oh man... Valentina.
Sort of. We met a couple of times. Can't you cover her up or something?
No shit. Jesus Christ, what a mess this all is.
You knew the victim?
Sorry, we've got to wait for the forensics and photographer. There's been violence all over so they're slow in coming.
Hey wait, did you know the family?
Olek is OK. I don't think the monsters who did this could bring themselves to harm the boy. I guess...
Fuck you you callous son of a bitch.
Good day, where's this man's boy?
We helped find this man's kid a while back... sort of...
Jesus, I know... I don't understand you people at all... You're crazy.
What's it to you?
Yeah, 'cause watching people string up your old man does no damage at all eh?
Ah, what's the matter? Maksim was a Russian, let them kill each other with this in-fighting, who cares?
Bah! It's being up here in the north surrounded by these Russian settlers! We're much saner down south!
Well if you won't cut them down, I will!
You wouldn't dare!
Stand down Sir! You have no rights here, this is a CDF Military Police crime scene, now back off. I have authority to shoot trespassers
Try me!
OK, I can understand that. It's just I knew them, it's hard not to get involved.
I'm sorry.
Hey you! Why haven't you cut these men down? What the hell's going on here?
Who the hell I look like? USMC Force Recon, we're with the 27th MEU you damn flatfoot! Now cut those men down!
Who are you?
No way. They've gotta stay up there till the boss come here.
Swordsman this is Razor. I'm approaching the location indicated by the intel we found on those gun-runners, over.
Jeez thanks for the tip Cap'...
It even discusses ways they intended to pin it on NAPA.
Road plans, times, names, everything. Hell, it's even got a note on it stressing the importance of framing NAPA in Lopotev's own damn handwriting. Over.
Just doing my job sir, over.
Shit! Contact! At least this is the right place!
Swordsman this is Razor. I... We were right Captain, the location was hot. We took care of it. Over.
Bingo!
Oh my god look at this....
Un-fucking-real...
Swordsman this is Razor, we've hit the jackpot here Captain.
How would you like what amounts to a signed confession from the Chedaki that they're responsible for the Moscow bombing? Over.
No shit sir. I have a Chedaki op-order here signed by Lopotev himself detailing the bombing operation in red square.
Die American!
Razor this is Swordsman, sitrep, over.
Copy Razor, proceed with caution. Don't just walk in there and say 'Hi', Out.
Copy Razor, sweep the shack for tactical intel and report back. Out.
This is Swordsman, what you got Coops?
Ha! That'd be a fine thing huh?
You lucky son of a bitch, Cooper. The brass are gonna love you...
Ah shut the hell up! Get your team back to Manhattan ASAP. That document's too valuable to leave out in the field.
I want you back in now Cooper. Don't let anything happen to that op-order. Swordsman Out.
You Razor? I hear you got a Guns and Ammo yard sale out here.
Oh yeah we got it, you're good to go.
Razor this is Battlemage, go ahead over.
Copy that Razor Team, good work. We'll send some boys over from Logistics, you're clear to move on to other objectives once they arrive, over.
Battlemage this is Razor. Message. Over.
Uh that's a roger on that NAPA activity at Gorka, Battlemage.
We've got a small-arms and ammunition dump here. Requesting support, over.
Copy Battlemage, standing by, out.
Copy that Corporal, it's all yours. You OK with this?
I'm sorry Father, I have to report this.
It wasn't my choice, Father. I can't make that kind of decision.
You are a cold man Sergeant. We need this protection.
Of course you had a choice! We will not forget this, American!
OK Father, I won't report this, but you have to help me now.
You can keep the weapons, but I want to know everything you know about NAPA movements and operations.
I want names, we need all intel you can give us! Start talking or we're taking this, and you, back with us.
OK, that's good. Thanks for the information Father. Promise me you'll try to keep these weapons in safe hands.
Cooper.
Bless you Sergeant! We won't forget your kindness. You've saved lives today! But what can I do for you?
There are some men in Novy Sobor who can help you. Talk to Vochozka, Staljety, Moucny or Prvnak, they all work in the coop farm...
They've been engaging the Chedaki. They can give you information.
I will. Thank you again Sergeant...
Sergeant Cooper. You are a good man and the Lord protects good men. You go with His, and my blessings.
You must be the local priest right?
That bad huh?
That is not possible, Father. We're ordered to search the village.
Is that right? You'd know huh?
Look it's OK, we're not going to turn over the whole village. Our spy drones have given us three areas, you know, three ares we need to check. Come on, what do you say?
So, nothing here? Then what's all this? You telling me you didn't know?
Who are you?
We don't need you here American Marines. Thank you for coming but you can leave now. There are no Chedaki here.
Alas I must, God is punishing me I suppose.
You see? Nothing here. I told you as much. Now will you please just go!
Empty! As I said. Now leave!
How much more proof do you need eh? May the Almighty strike you down if you do not get out of here immediately!
Please, you don't understand. You don't live here. You don't know what it's like!
NAPA ask us to keep this here for them, just so they can help us.
Please. Leave them with us. You see what the Chedaki do to us here? The CDF are not helping us here. You Americans are not helping us here. NAPA are helping us here.
Let them help us. Please.
You will leave and then what will we do when the Chedaki come? Tell me!

I am Father Fyodor, Gorka is my home. I can assure you we are most comfortable here. We can look after ourselves. We have no need for American protection. Thank you for your concern but you can leave.
No, no impossible. I would know about it.
Hmm. Very well. Let's go. But I tell you now you won't find anything.
Can't you take my word for it? There's nothing here, please just go.
Look there's nothing here. You have my word, I swear.
Gorka is a quiet village, you are worrying my sheep, Sergeant! Just go!
Who's there? Who are you? Get out! Get away from there! There's nothing for you here!
I am Father Fyodor, Gorka is my home. We can look after ourselves. We have no need for American protection. There's nothing for you here!
Bingo! I got the cache here guys.
Say they did do it, would that be so bad anyway? Good for them I say. I've got no love for the Russians...

... and what would you know about it anyway?
Don't take it to heart? Are you mad? Do you have any idea what this means for us?
Those stupid NAPA thugs have brought the fucking Reds back on us, is this what you want? To be like it was before?
This idiot's not old enough to remember properly but you should know better!
Oh of course it was NAPA you bloody fool.
You'd know all about stupidity, that's for sure!
Christ! What an idiot!
The Red's will be all over us now, hell, I'm surprised they aren't here already!
It was you thick farmer!
A lot more than a stupid farmer like you!
There's no proof it was even NAPA! What are you talking about!?
No you're wrong there my friend, they are powerful enough, they're just not stupid enough to do something like bomb Moscow!
Of course it would!
But it wasn't fucking NAPA!
You want settle this like a man?
Hey! Hey calm down, don't take it to heart so much!
Now hold on, he's got a point. NAPA don't have the resources to do something like this, they're just like us! Well... not just like us... but you know...
Oh come on...
Of course it's bad! If they believe NAPA are responsible, do you really think the Russians would leave Chernarus to the Americans?
Anytime!

Oh my son! I left him! I just ran!
Head along the cowshed to the water tower and then north into the forest. There's an old shed in a clearing not far inside. It was near there. Please, please hurry! Find my son!
But he's my son! I have to come with you!
I already told you people on the phone, this is wasting time!
Jesus Christ in Heaven! We were looking for mushrooms in the woods. Olek, that's my son, was only about thirty meters away from me but I could still see him.
He went into a thicket out of sight so I went after him.
Spoken like a true Russian! This is my son we're talking about!
We all know exactly what you meant.
There was a Chedaki soldier there walking away towards a big camp holding Olek under his arm. Olek had a cut on his head, I think he'd been knocked out. I thought he was dead at first!
Then Olek lifted his head and saw me. He called out and the soldier turned around and started firing. I had to run for my life!
Be quiet Maksim! Don't talk about the Chedaki! You'll regret it if you do!
I.. uh.. So what if I have Russian blood? I Just meant that the Chedaki would be angry if you talked... That's all...

This is Radio Chernarus, Chernarussian Public Radio. Forty three people have been confirmed killed and as many as two hundred wounded by the explosion that rocked Moscow's famous Red Square earlier today. Many experts warn that these figures are expected to rise.
The Kremlin instantly issued a statement ruling out accidental cause although the bombing has yet to be claimed by any recognized terrorist group.

The explosion, which tore through crowds of early morning shoppers and site-seers also damaged the iconic St. Basil's Cathedral. The Russian media have been quick to blame the current conflict here in Chernarus as the catalyst for today's attack, unashamedly pointing the finger of blame at the organization of resistance fighters known as NAPA. Other less-biased analysts believe the bombing to be the work of an isolated group of fanatics unconnected with NAPA or any other Chernarussian group.

Although Radio Chernarus has been unable to contact a spokesperson for the NAPA organization, we would like to use this moment to appeal to any NAPA officials currently listening to come on air with us and refute these alarmist claims.
We will of course be monitoring the situation and will update you with all the latest developments as they occur. Radio Chernarus, Chernarussian Public Radio.
This is the local Chernarussian Radio station, they're saying forty dead and two hundred wounded in the Moscow bombing.
They're saying it's no accident, but that no-one's claimed responsibility yet.
The announcer is now making attack on the Russian media, he's saying they're biased and wrong because they've already started to blame NAPA.
And now he's saying... We want a NAPA representative to come on air and refute these alarmist claims... blah blah blah.
That's about it.
RVR Russian Voice Radio. Over fifty people have been murdered and nearly five hundred injured in the blast that devastated the heart of the capital, Red Square in Moscow today.

The death toll is almost certain to rise. The bombing also destroyed part of St. Basil's Cathedral, a spokesperson for the Church, who was uninjured, said this was "an indication that the terrorists who caused the explosion care as little for God or world heritage as they do for human life."

Although the Kremlin is understandably reluctant to accuse any particular group at this stage, the vast body of expert opinion supports the idea that the infamous NAPA terrorist organization is behind the terrible attack. NAPA made the headlines earlier this week in war-torn Chernarus for the torture and murder of Civilians in the North of that troubled country.

Earlier in this programme a high ranking Russian Ground Forces officer, who wishes to remain anonymous, told RVR "It has become clear that the Americans cannot control Chernarus. Their incompetence is destabilizing the region and we must act to restore the balance.

It is our duty to both protect Russia, and to aid the people of Chernarus." The President would not comment, but insiders tell us there is growing impatience at the Kremlin for direct action in our fracturing neighbor-state.
RVR will be back with more as the situation develops.
This is actually a Russian station talking. They're saying fifty dead and like, five hundred wounded...
They spoke to some church guy 'cause you know that thing with the domes was hit, uh he's not happy!
These guys are saying it's pretty obvious NAPA are behind the bombing, but that the Kremlin won't admit it officially.
Now they have some Russian army officer blaming us! Jesus. Calling the US incompetent and whatnot, destabilizing the region. What an asshole.
Shit, they're saying they want to send the Russians in here now... And that's about it.
Uh... Michal... these guys know us...
Yeah, don't get us wrong we're happy someone else is fighting the Chedaki but why should we help you?
What?
Michal, no! We were planning...
Excuse me sir... I'm looking for four men from this village, Michal, Zbychek, Martin and Honza.
We need information. Father Fyodor gave us your names, he said you'd be able to tell us about Chedaki operations in this area.
Look, we found weapons in Gorka, we know you're NAPA fighters so you can drop the act.
Don't panic, we didn't report the guns nor the cache. That means we've already taken a risk for you. You owe us.
Or you know, we could just take you in and seize your weapons after all...
We don't want your help with the fighting. We're not here to help you take revenge.
Just give us the coordinates of this base and these sentry camps and let us do our job, OK?
That's plenty Michal. Thanks for the information, but don't get any ideas about those weapons.
We left them so you could help defend the villages, not launch attacks, understood? We know who you are now.
That fucking god-bother!
Quiet! Why would the Father think we could help you, American?
Jesus Martin...
There are always Chedaki raids and ambushes along that road, more than anywhere else, and they always bug out north into woods.
Other than that there's not much I can say.
OK, take care out there American. You may wish you'd let us come along when you see what you're up against...
Huh! Is that right?
OK, fine. Look, I can tell you where there's a large Chedaki camp, maybe that will help?
It's always been too tough a target for us anyway! Maybe if the Americans take it down we have a chance with the sentry camps. It'll be like old times!
Very well. We know from patrol counts that they have 6 sentry camps, we don't know the locations because they're always moving the sites.
The main camp is somewhere west of Vyshnaya Dubrovka for sure.
We know because village people there say there are always Chedaki in the town buying up or just taking supplies.
There is more of them than anywhere else. They get trouble and most important, leave heading west into the hills.
The main camp has to be somewhere north of the road that runs between Krasnostav and Gvozdno.

This is the GBR Global Service Report. As many as fifty people are thought to have been killed and around one hundred seriously injured in the attack which shook Moscow's famous Red Square earlier today. Many of the victims were foreign tourists visiting the Square which is flanked by both the Kremlin and St. Basil's Cathedral. The iconic Cathedral also took damage in the blast. GBR's Moscow correspondent John McNully had this report.
And John's report can be heard in full as a podcast from our website at the usual address. This is the Great British Radio Global Service Report.

Clearly the explosion this morning in Red Square highlights the need, in the most tragic way imaginable, for greater Russian engagement in the troubles of this region." That's a quote from a State Duma minister talking to me shortly after the Red Square bombing this morning. Minutes later we were asked by Kremlin officials not to use the interview, or even name the minister until the Kremlin make an official statement later today. It's amazing that we managed to speak to anyone inside the Kremlin at all this morning. Journalists, like everyone else, have been banned from the Square itself. A cordon of five hundred meters has been set up around the city center and a no-fly zone is in place over the whole city. The only pictures we can get are taken from the roofs of nearby hotels and other buildings. Confusion reigns in the Kremlin and indeed across all Moscow in the aftermath of the bombing. Initial reports from reliable government sources initially suggested the attack had been the work of the Chernarussian guerilla group NAPA but these claims were swiftly retracted by officials who denied any organization was officially being held responsible. This hasn't stopped many parts of the Russian media leaping on those early statements and running with the NAPA story. The truth is that here in Russia, fears about the Chernarussian conflict spilling over into the motherland are sky-high, however irrational, and so far, the Kremlin isn't doing much to talk the people down. John McNully, GBR News, Moscow.

ChDKZ base destroyed

Razor team managed to destroy the ChDKZ base and several smaller sentry points in the area of operations. With your help, the Chedaki military forces in the area were crushed and the rest of the movement can be eradicated using Chernarussian police and peacekeeping forces.
Your agreement with Father Fyodor is another achievement. Although it is unofficial and your superiors should never learn about it, NAPA's attitude toward the USMC has improved, which may well prove beneficial in the future.
However, your success is overshadowed by the bombing in Moscow. Disappointed with the US invasion of Chernarus from the beginning, no one can guess how the Russian Federation will react now.
ChDKZ base destroyed

Razor team managed to destroy the ChDKZ base and several smaller sentry points in the area of operations. With your help, the Chedaki military forces in the area were crushed and the rest of the movement can be eradicated using Chernarussian police and peacekeeping forces.
Reporting Father Fyodor's weapon cache was definitely a good thing - the less weapons in the hands of civilians, the better. The question now however, is what damage has this done to the USMC's relationship with NAPA. So far relations have been good...
Your success is overshadowed by the bombing in Moscow. Disappointed with the US invasion of Chernarus from the beginning, no one can guess how the Russian Federation will react now.
Military court

War is harsh. Innocent people are bound to be caught up in any conflict. It's worse however, when death comes at the hands of those sent to protect. In your case the number of civilians killed exceeds any tolerable amount for any one unit. We cannot write off these incidents as unavoidable accident. You and your men will suffer courts martial, charged with war-crimes. Evidence against you is being gathered. Your military career ends here.
Killed in action
A member of Razor Team was killed. This is unacceptable in the current situation. The mission was immediately canceled and Razor Team extracted.
Well if you won't, I will!
OK, I understand.
I must report it.
I won't report it.

This is quite a sensitive objective. A significant portion of the population give aid to the local militias. We have identified two civilians who are secretly helping the Chedaki in the AO. The main contact is Lev Nokolayev. He lives in Khelm but other than that we know very little about him. Make finding out more your priority. The other contact is a woman called Antonia Lagushina. she lives in a house in Gvozdno (see pictures), but frequently travels to Krasnostav. If you find her, arrest her and call in for further instructions.
Arrest 'Chedaki' contact

You have captured Antonia Lagushina. She must be escorted to a landing zone where Ltn. Marny's people will take custody. It's likely that one of the insurgent sides will try to attack the transport or designated landing zone if they discover that we have her in transit. Her death would be unfortunate.
Escort contact to LZ
Callsign 'Boomerang' are en route to support the strike on the Chedaki main camp. Use all means to assist them and destroy the camp. Artillery is available (Callsign 'Mike'), use the support well.
Destroy the ChDKZ base

This is an emergency operation. Razor need to rescue a downed CDF Mi-17 crew and await the arrival of a MEDEVAC truck that will take the survivors back to the airstrip at Krasnostav. After securing any survivors report in and make sure they are safe until CDF extraction arrives.
Recover downed crew
Interview Maskim
HINT: New Intel added to Diary

We're being redeployed to the mountainous region in the Northeast around Krasnostav. We've established an FOB up there to help the CDF keep the locals under control. Despite most of Chernarus now being under nominal CDF control this region is proving troublesome for the brass on both sides of the alliance. A guerilla group called NAPA are harassing the Chedaki and normally that'd be fine by me, but they're not keeping their reprisals to combatants. The CDF simply don't have the right stuff for this kind of conflict (I'm tempted to say any type of conflict...) so once again we have to bail them out. I just hope this doesn't turn into another quagmire.
Reach FOB Manhattan checkpoint 'Brooklyn' and report to Cpt. Shaftoe.
Report to Cpt. Shaftoe
REPORT
Mission Plan

The Chernarussian Defence Force is in control of the majority of the country thanks to the swift and decisive involvement of the USMC. However, insurgency is on the increase. The Krasnostav area is still seeing heavy counter-insurgency fighting between the CDF, ChDKZ ''Sotnya'' remnants and NAPA guerilla groups. Although enemies of the ChDKZ, there is no 'official' line concerning the NAPA group's attitude toward the USMC and it's allies. They should be approached with caution. The ChDKZ are operating from the forests that dominate this area of operation, popping up for occasional hit and run strikes on weak targets. Forward Operating Base 'Manhattan' has been established east of the town of Krasnostav to deal with the conflict in this area. Immediate USMC intervention is needed to assist the CDF who largely lack the appropriate counter-insurgency training for this area of operations. Our role in the AO is to find and eliminate key ChDKZ personnel, camps, strong-points and supporters. Razor Team will redeploy from Elektrozavodsk and rendezvous at FOB Manhattan checkpoint 'Brooklyn'. From there Razor should report to Capt. Shaftoe re: their deployment in the AO.
Layout of FOB Manhattan.
环境

The Krasnostav area is a deeply divided region of Chernarus. Local attitudes toward the CDF (and their allies) are fickle at best. While we can expect some support from the local population there are many ethic Russian settlers in this area who feel threatened by the CDF/USMC presence and the legitimacy this could be seen to lend the anti-ChDKZ militias such as NAPA. Our goal is to minimize the conflict in this area, not encourage rival militia violence. NAPA activity is highest in the west where there have been some attacks on ChDKZ sympathizers, as well as direct firefights between NAPA and ChDKZ.
Chedaki activity near Krasnostav:

Although ChDKZ rule in Chernarus was short, they managed to commit a lot of warcrimes. Now they're attempting to hide any evidence of these atrocities. Your task is to have your eyes open and find as much evidence of ChDKZ warcrimes as possible. This evidence is also a great political tool leverage support for the invasion with the public.
Find evidence

The CDF has control of the majority of the country, thanks to the swift and decisive involvement of the USMC. However, insurgency is on the increase in the Krasnostav region. Forward Operating Base <marker name="BIS_FOB">'Manhattan'</marker> has been established south of the town of <marker name="BIS_krasnoPos">Krasnostav</marker> in this area. Immediate USMC intervention is needed to assist the CDF who lack the counter-insurgency training.
After landing, Razor Team will rendezvous at FOB Manhattan checkpoint <marker name="BIS_scene6">'Brooklyn'</marker>. Report to Capt. Shaftoe re: Razor deployment in the area of operation.

Razor Team will neutralize the Chedaki power base in this area of operation, finding and eliminating key ChDKZ personnel, camps, strong points and supporters. Razor will investigate the possible presence of anti-ChDKZ NAPA insurgents and weapon caches in the area.

The area of operation is still seeing heavy counter-insurgency fighting between the CDF, ChDKZ and NAPA guerilla groups. The NAPA group's attitude towards the USMC and CDF is unclear; but they are hostile toward the Chedaki. Approach them with caution. The ChDKZ are operating from the forests, popping up for occasional hit and run strikes on weak targets. They have one main base and several sentry points.

Command Element – Callsign: 'Battlemage'.
Logistical Support (on demand) – 1x UH-1Y flight. Callsign: 'Star Force 21', 1x LAV-25.
Artillery Support (on demand) – 3x 81mm Mortar battery. Callsign: 'Mike'
Intelligence Support - 1x Unmanned Aerial Vehicle. Terminal located in the Manhattan FOB.

Insurgent sentry posts

The ChDKZ SOP is to establish many satellite insurgency camps and a central command camp. If they maintain this SOP the central camp will be their main logistical source, the base of their command structure and the center for their communications in this area of operations. Find that base and we can nip the insurgency in the bud.
Insurgent main base
CHEDAKI BASE

Weapons smuggling is rife in the area despite our checkpoints. We've picked up some very accurate intel pointing toward a white closed-top pick up truck being used to ferry guns and munitions for a militia operation out of Krasnostav (see photographs). You are free to engage this target should you come across it. Use any force necessary to stop those weapons being delivered.

GORKA

This is quite a sensitive objective. A significant portion of the population gives aid to the local militas. We have identified two civilians who are secretly helping the Chedaki in the AO.

Arrest Nikolayev

After the rapid collapse of much of the ChDKZ command infrastructure many units are regressing back to their pre-war 'Sotnya' groups (large guerilla formations spread across a wide area). Sotnya command is always centralized around a key figure. Razor must identify and eliminate the leader of the Krasnostav guerrilla group. He will most likely be found at the main command camp. Razor must confirm his identity before taking him out.
Insurgent leader
CONTACT

The satellite camps are the staging point for ChDKZ insurgent activity across the AO. Find and report as many of these bases as you can, destroying the camps should you have the means. Contact reports point to some of the possible locations for these camps, namely the hills and ruin west of FOB Manhattan and the hilly area in the west of Olsha.

MAKSIM
Antonia Lagushina: Daily Routine
Various Intel suggests ChDKZ sentry camps can be found in these locations.
Insurgent leader photo and description
The ChDKZ Sotnya Krasnostav leader is male. We don't know much else, other than he's a hard man to catch. This is the best photo we've been able to get.

Antonia Lagushina lives in Gvozdno. She drives a red hatchback. She uses this nearly every day to travel to Krasnostav on various errands. She also visits the local church between 1100-1230 for midday mass. After this she visits her boyfriend in Olsha, or else travels home and usually stays there until about 1900 when she goes to the local pub.
Lev Nikolayev: Daily Routine

Lev Nikolayev lives in Khelm. He's an odd, but paradoxically regular character. He is always present at the post office for opening hours every day. The office should open at 0600, but generally opens between 0610-0645 according to the clerk’s mood. Nikolayev is always there at 0600 and waits patiently. He then goes shopping at a local grocery store and is home by 0800 at the latest. He generally stays home for the rest of the day, receiving many visitors (presumably his ChDKZ contacts).
Weapon cache positions
Our confidence is high that there is a NAPA weapon cache in Gorka. It is located at one of <marker name="BIS_gorkaCachesCenter">three suspected positions</marker>.
Smuggler’s description
The arms smuggler's name is Lazar Podchalyuzin. He always travels alone in his white Coyota Offroad Pickup.

Yes Sir!

Attention all USMC personnel. The last ground transports for embarkation will be leaving in 10 minutes gentlemen, that's one zero minutes.
As you all know by 1700hrs there won't be a marine within 50 miles of this country, so don't forget your damned toothbrushes.
I know you're all angry about the way the UN went, the USEUCOM withdrawal and the damned Russians, but don't let anger cloud your judgment in these last few hours, we're going home.
Cooper, your squad with me. Simmons tag along, this concerns Sabre too.
Dressler's on board that bird, we've got one last Recon op before you guys get to bug out.
Meow! Catfight! Calm down girls you might break a nail.
Hey that's no way to talk to the guy who saved your life! If it wasn't for me you'd be rotting in that warehouse.
Hey, at least we get to go home now.
This fucking sucks! It's not over! We can't leave!
Since when did we just roll over for the Reds?! Come on!
Fuck off Simmons.
I hate to say it but I gotta agree with Robo, leaving Chernarus to the Russians is nuts, plain nuts.
Star Force 21 this is Razor Team requesting immediate extraction. Sending coordinates, over.
Copy that Star Force 21. We'll take that trip, over!
All in, good to go Maddox!

Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is Star Force 21, we've taken a critical hit just north of Shakovka and are losing altitude, I repeat Star Force 21 going down.
Jesus I can't hold her!

And the CDF have just folded in the south, they don't have any fight left at all. They're just rolling over for those Reds.

Shit shit shit!

Hey Marines! Boo! We thought you guys were supposed to be the best! How come we can sneak up on you then eh?
I am Sergeant Boleslavsky. We already know who you are. We were told to keep an eye open in case your team showed up.
We take you back to Zelenogorsk, Colonel Begunov will want to see you.
Bohatyr this is Vydra, Bohatyja ti por this is Vydra. We found those missing marines, we're bringing them in. Out.
Head's up guys, I think that's CDF over there. Finally! They haven't seen us, let's move in slowly just in case.
Hey, head's up. I got CDF approaching, they've seen us. Finally!
OK they've seen us now, we're all good. Let's go talk to them, remember we're all friends here.
Hi there! Damn it's good to see a friendly face!
Boy are we glad to see you. We're with the 27th MEU, Force Recon Razor Team.
We got cut off from our chain of command. Can you get us out of here?
Yeah we're like a bad penny. That's good to hear, for a while back there we felt pretty forgotten. What's the plan?
OK Sergeant. Lead the way. We got nothing keeping us here...
Ah! Thank you Sergeant. Welcome welcome Razor Team! I'm glad it turned out how we'd hoped!
Just because you ship is out of sight Sergeant Cooper, does not mean we have lost touch. We have made plans in case you should arrive...
If we allow it, by this time tomorrow all of Chernarus will be in the hands of these Russian 'peacekeepers' and when they have it, do you think they'll let go?
They are cooperating with the Chedaki! We know this! How can any peace ever come from such deception?
No! There can be no peace while the Russian military walks our lands. We demand our sovereign rights! This is our country and we have been pushed around long enough.
Tomorrow, we begin to push back!
Ah! Yes of course. We can't keep your Captain waiting. We contacted the Khe Sanh as soon as we heard you were coming.
Please, use the satphone on the table. Captain Shaftoe is expecting you.
Thank you sir, but, eh... What do you mean exactly?
Uh yeah yeah. That's great Colonel. Say do you think we can talk to our ship now?
Yeah, I guess so...
Hey Robo, remember what you were saying about leaving this morning? Looks like you got your wish.
Hey Captain, guess who.
Relax Captain, we just got intercepted en route. The CDF are taking good care of us.
Do you know what happened to Maddox? We got a garbled mayday.
Yeah we got hit by a SAM. Maddox didn't make it.
I'm afraid not sir, we haven't spoken to him since we decided not to fly.
Uhm... I'm not sure sir, it's... It's getting out of hand here. Simmons was right, the Russians are definitely after us.
Well, uh... Well guys, you heard, what do think?
All right Captain, you're on, we'll do it.
Shaftoe.
Holy shit it's good to hear your voice Cooper! I didn't dare believe Begunov when he told me. How's your team? What happened?
Outstanding! All right Cooper, we'll be in touch. I've got to report this. It's good to have you back Razor Team, Shaftoe out.
Damn that's bad news.
Listen, we figured you might still be alive, USEUCOM have a plan. They still want to run black ops inside Chernarus.
The CDF will begin resisting the Russian occupation in the morning. We want to help them covertly.
With a plausibly deniable Recon team already in situ JSOC felt you might consider taking the job.
Razor, how would you feel about remaining MIA?
All the more reason to stay undercover then huh? Look don't take it personally but I just don't believe the Russians are that dumb.
Maybe some of them are a bit trigger happy out there but are you really telling me you think the entire Russian Federation wants you dead? Come on!
Outstanding marines! I'm assigning you to CDF command effective immediately. We'll be in touch to brief you fully, but for now your ass belongs to them, understood?
Colonel, this is Razor Team. We found them wandering around up north.
Jesus guys... Ah hell, what choice have we got? I'm in.
Jesus, get a load of this guy...
Shit, I thought it was gonna take me years to get into Special Ops like this, are you kidding?
Hell yeah! Hey! Do you think we are gonna get pay grade increase?
Sounds like a blast to me.
Hold on.
Oh god, what happened?
Medic! Scarlet! Shit, is that you Simmons?
Is he gone?
Razor, over here...
God, do I look that bad? Cooper, Spukayev's dead. The Chedaki jumped the base. Fucking cowards waited until the others cleared out. They came for us.
I didn't even get a shot off. I was on the horn to you, heard a bunch of thumps, then it started raining grenades.
When I came round most of the guys were dead, there were 'dakis picking through the mess.
Some of them looked like Russian Spetsnaz too. Right gear, right face. Should've guessed the Reds would fuck us.
Of course I'm right dumbass! I was here!
They were asking for you! By your damn names. You guys are so fucked!
There was this one really blond guy, Russian for sure. "Are you Razor? Where is Cooper?"
He flipped when we wouldn't tell him, just went down the line and knifed us, one, two, three, like that. I'm pretty screwed, right Scarlet?
Hey come here...
Jesus, you smell that? Shit is that smoke coming from Manhattan?
Don't call me that.
Bastard.
Yeah. Sorry Coops, nothing I could do.
He said he saved our ass again...
What'd he say?
Motherload of small explosion burns here Coops. Small cluster-bomblets maybe? Or even grenades.
He might be right Coops. Looking at those bodies, could easily be Spetsnaz.
OK, thanks a lot!
You know what? I've changed my mind. Go on get out of here!
I like the bitter chill.
Please, you got a long range radio? We need to contact our ship.
Even better. We can call Shaftoe's cell!
Yeah, I'm starting to regret that...
We're not your enemy, we're just trying to get out of here.
Please, you got a long range radio? We need to contact our ship.
Even better. We can call Shaftoe's cell!
Hey there Captain.
We got intercepted en route. We're holed up with some NAPA fighters in a safehouse.
Do you know what happened to Maddox? We got a garbled mayday.
Yeah we got hit by a SAM. Maddox didn't make it.
We're marines, we were sent here by some friends of yours.
I'm afraid not sir, we haven't spoken to him since we decided not to fly.
Uh. OK... What's the other option?
The Russian's are hunting us Captain. Simmons was right all along. They want us dead!
Well, you heard, what do think guys?
All right Captain, you're on, we'll do it.
Hey Robo, remember what you were saying about leaving this morning? Looks like you got your wish.
Look, I'm Sergeant Cooper of the 27th MEU, Force Recon Razor Team. I'm cold, I'm tired and I'm pissed off, now let me talk to your boss!
Uh, yeah, yeah. I really gotta start saying that right off the bat...
Nevermind, nothing. So will you help us?
Please, you got a long range radio? We need to contact our ship.
Even better. We can call Shaftoe's cell!
Uhm yeah, yeah, I really gotta start saying that right off the bat...
Nevermind, nothing. So will you help us?
What?
Anyway, we're glad to have you here, marines. We plan to move out to a rally point tomorrow morning and start capturing the no-man's land between the coast and the Russian-held territory.
You're highly trained men, our supreme leaders agreed to offer you to command our troops. Most of us have no military experience, the Russians would kill us in a matter of minutes.
Sure, we heard what you did for Father Fyodor, I guess we owe you one. What do you want?
Well, we've got a satellite phone. That OK?
It's over there on the table. Be careful! It took Pepa hours to get it aligned.
Razor Team? I've heard of you! You're the bastards who took Fyodor's guns!
Yes, I bet you are now you need us! Why should we help you?
That, I can see the benefit of. So how do we make it happen?
Well, we've got a satellite phone. That OK?
It's over there on the table. Be careful! It took Pepa hours to get it aligned.
We can always use extra fighters. You can use our comms to stay in touch with your CoC.
OK. That's good. Now who the hell are you?
There aren't any marines left in Chernarus, they all ran away! You must be these impostors the Russians are looking for.
Wait? You're Razor Team?
What?
Of course! Everyone in NAPA has heard of Razor Team. Helping Fyodor the way you did and taking on those Chedaki camps, you guys are legendary! Heroes! What can we do for you?
Well, we've got a satellite phone. That OK?
It's over there on the table. Be careful! It took Pepa hours to get it aligned.
Wait? You're Razor Team?
Alright alright, just calm down. We will lead you to the castle ruin, our HQ's in there.
Honey is that you? I didn't think you were gonna call at this hour!
Holy shit Cooper! You're alive? Jesus! How's the team? What happened?
Damn that's bad news.
Hand yourselves over to the Russians and come on home. There'll be some complaint from the Reds but...
Listen, we figured you might still be alive, USEUCOM have a plan. They still want to run black ops inside Chernarus.
How would feel about remaining officially MIA?
All the more reason to stay undercover then huh? Look don't take it personally but I just don't believe the Russians are that dumb.
Maybe some of them are a bit trigger happy out there but are you really telling me you think the entire Russian Federation wants you dead? Come on!
Outstanding! All right Cooper, we'll be in touch. I've got to report this now. It's good to have you back Razor Team, Shaftoe out.
Jesus guys... Ah hell, what choice have we got? I'm in.
Shit, I thought it was gonna take me years to get into Special Ops like this, are you kidding?
Hell yeah! Hey! Do you think we'll get pay grade increase?
Sounds like a blast to me.
You there! Do you want to come inside? There's a storm coming!
Copy that.
Yes Sir!
Enjoy the bag-man job Razor.
Got it Sir.
Sir!
Sure. OK listen up Marines, we caught a break. One of the Lopotev's under-lieutenants wants to defect and spill his guts about the ChDKZ, Moscow and all the rest.
Spukayev, that's the guy, can confirm the involvement of ChDKZ operatives in what they call 'Operation Cobalt', the Moscow bombing.
Now by rights his evidence, along with the other documents we have, should convince the Russians that the ChDKZ are the real threat here.
But Spukayev is worried. The Russians have moved so fast on this thing everyone's left guessing who to trust.
There's just too much room for error out there. Now the Russian 'peacekeepers' are moving in we need to extract Spukayev and recover his files before something goes wrong.
The Russians have restricted our airspace to evacuation flight paths only, so your Huey transports are out for these objectives.
All right. Spukayev's blown any ties he had with the ChDKZ calling for this extraction so they are probably already en route to his house. Don't let them get there before you Razor Team.
Everything clear?
Good, we're all here. Let's get started. Captain Dressler, you wanna fill them in?
Simmons, I'm sending your team in after him. Cooper, Spukayev has a safehouse west of Krasnostav at 028104. I want you to take Razor and recover those files.
Razor, take a Hummer and get to that safehouse ASAP. Return to Manhattan with the files and Star Force 21 will extract you to back to the Khe Sanh.

There won't be much of the FOB left by the time you get back. As you know our deadline for complete withdrawal is 1700hrs. After that, there won't be a marine within fifty miles of Chernarus, understood?
Simmons, Spukayev himself is at Khelm so your part in this won't take long. Rendezvous with him there and provide a safe escort back here for extraction.
When you have the Plan Cobalt files, destroy any other materials that could be deemed sensitive. We can't let the Russians or his former employers get their hands on it.
Dressler and I are leaving for the Khe Sanh immediately. Gentlemen, your teams will be among the very last to leave the FOB, so make sure you turn out the lights.
All right then let's move.

Jesus Christ marine it could've been anybody, hell, it could've been your NAPA guys dressed as Spetsnaz for all you know.

Hold fire please! Friendlies coming out!
Hello! Hello there! We didn't expect to find anyone alive up here. You're lucky!

Come on, we'll take you to some transport, drive you to Elektrozavodsk. You can rendezvous with the marines there.
Risky my friend. There are SAM sites going up all over the area. The Chedaki are suddenly very well armed...
Easy! We don't have any fight with you. My name is Alesh, we're with NAPA.

Hard to miss! We were tracking the Russians when they joined the assault on this base.

You have to pick fights you know you will win in our situation my friend. We don't have men to waste.
Listen, you'd better not hang around here. The Russians have declared the north free of USMC now.
They're saying any armed person will be considered hostile.
We heard the announcements in the villages on the way in here. They are looking for 'insurgents impersonating US personnel'.
Tell me about it! Hang on, stay back.
We're trying, believe me. What's the problem here?
You got that right. Look we're cut off from the rest of the MEU, we need to get hold of Father Fyodor or maybe even some CDF officers. We need help.
OK, thanks.
You too. Don't take any shit from those Russians.
Wait! Stop! You shouldn't be here!
I thought you marines were all leaving?

I'm sorry, the CDF are useless, we haven't seen them. The Father isn't here either. He fled when the Russians came.
But I know he'd want to help you. The marines have been good to him. Listen, there is a NAPA safehouse just west of here in the fields, you can't miss it.

They'll ask you a code phrase. They'll say a storm is coming and you must say that you like the bitter chill. Use those words, OK? I'm not supposed to talk about it but I know it's what the Father would want. Go there, they will be able to get you out.
You could head west. I know there are some NAPA fighters in Novy Sobor who might help. Try talking to to Michal or Martin there.
Yes yes no problem, now go on, get out of here! Good luck!

Eat this assholes!

Razor this is Swordsman. Good job, get back to Manhattan ASAP. Out.

Get your men back to the FOB, Marine. We need you out before the Russians arrive. Swordsman out.

Maddox?

Well, what can I say? I like American music! Woo! Rock'n'roll!

Apart from the bowling?

Swordsman this is Razor, message over.

Cooperation with CDF

Razor Team have been ordered to work alongside the CDF as deniable US operatives in Chernarus. Officially outside the US chain of command (declared MIA) and autonomous, for the time being Razor should support the CDF and follow their orders where possible.
Killed in action
One of Razor Team was Killed In Action. Extraction proved impossible. Razor team declared MIA, presumed dead.
Cooperation with NAPA

Razor Team have been ordered work alongside NAPA as deniable US operatives in Chernarus. Officially outside the US chain of command (declared MIA) and autonomous, for the time being Razor should support NAPA and its operations where possible.
Military court

War is harsh. Innocent people are bound to be caught up in any conflict. It's worse however, when death comes from the hands of those sent to protect. In your case the number of civilians killed exceeds any tolerable amount for any one unit. We cannot write these incidents off as unavoidable accident. You and your men will suffer courts martial, charged with war-crimes. Evidence against you is being gathered. Your military career ends here.
War's End

Razor successfully boarded the Khe Sanh and left Chernarus. Sabre Team never made it back. For the USMC the war ends here. Razor hide the fact they never returned to the FOB, secretly fearing things could have been different had they completed their objectives. Maybe their war wouldn't have ended so suddenly...
Killed in action
A Razor Team member was killed. This is unacceptable in the current situation. The mission was immediately canceled and Razor extracted.
Razor Team was killed by Russian Armed Forces Spetsnaz operatives while trying to reach BLUFOR positions.
We'll take it!
OK, stand down.
OK, thanks a lot!
Hey, I like the bitter chill.

Mission Plan

The 27th MEU is leaving Chernarussian territory today, 17. October 2009 at 1700hrs, to be replaced by Russian Federation peacekeepers. The Kremlin claimed that USMC forces were incapable of controlling terrorist organizations - namely NAPA - convincing the UN to rescind it's approval. Many feel the Russians would have invaded anyway and that the UN complied so as not to seem toothless should the Federation act unilaterally. Without UN backing, the US feel forced to abandon Chernarus to the Russians. After the attack on Moscow sympathy and support for this position is widespread, with global public opinion and many national governments supporting the move. Razor Team will secure FOB Manhattan until it is dismantled and will then transfer directly to the Khe Sanh, leaving the region via the Khardaran strait. The transition from US to Russian control will of necessity be chaotically swift, USEUCOM has ordered there be no contact between the two powers.

ChDKZ rule in Chernarus was short, but they managed to commit a lot of warcrimes. Now they're trying to hide the evidence. Your task is to have your eyes open and find as much evidence on ChDKZ warcrimes as possible. This evidence is also a great political tool for selling the invasion to the public.

The UN Security Council has withdrawn their USMC peacekeeping mandate, replacing them with Russian Federation Forces. The 27th MEU is to pull out from Chernarus. <marker name="BIS_FOB">FOB Manhattan</marker> is being dismantled and the last troops await transportation to <marker name="BIS_SFDest">Elektrozavodsk</marker> before returning to the USS Khe Sanh.

Razor Team will patrol in and around <marker name="BIS_FOB">FOB Manhattan</marker>. No enemy activity is expected. After the last units have been dispatched, Razor Team will board Star Force 21 and leave.
Razor Team will secure the final evacuation of materiel and personnel from <marker name="BIS_FOB">FOB Manhattan</marker>.

Most elements of the 27th MEU are aboard the Khe Sanh. The USMC’s previous positions are now being taken over by the CDF who lack sufficient experienced personnel. Final elements, mostly Recon and Intel units, such as Razor Team, are to be moved to the USS Khe Sanh by 1700.
Extraction – 1x UH-1Y Venom, Callsign: 'Star Force 21'.
The following day, FOB Manhattan

Go to Spukayev's house west of Krasnostav, secure the 'Operation Cobalt' files and destroy the rest by any means. OPFOR intelligence knows about Spukayev's defection and are probably en route to his house. Spukayev's evidence is necessary to prove Chedaki involvement in the Moscow bombing, so be sure to get there first. After completing the task, return to FOB Manhattan ASAP.

Reach USMC positions in the south ASAP. You must reach the south coast before 1700hrs. After that time the USS Khe Sanh will be too far offshore to provide extraction.
