Hey enough of the lectures, we know our situation. All I need are objectives.
Just tell us where we're needed and we'll be out of your hair, OK?
Hey can we just get on with this?
So you're the big tough marines who are going to show us how things are done eh? Well if you've got any sense you'll watch how we do things.
You can't just call a Blackhawk to come rescue you when things get ugly.
Hey, that's fine by me 'pal'.
There are four main settlements we need to control in this region. The Sobors, Stary and Novy, Pogorevka and Rogovo.
With the APC we can establish a base and continue our expansion out to the other towns.
If we see any NAPA fighters we'll just have to play it by ear. We don't know if they'll support us.
We know they're operating in the north however, so at some point, assuming we survive that long...
... we'll probably make contact.
Resisting the Russians is one thing, but if we're seen actively cooperating with NAPA that'll really piss them off.
Ah you should have more faith.
You think you know fighting? Let me tell you, things work differently here.
Pogorevka is our first target. If we can secure that, Captain Stavovich will send us an APC with supplies and long range comms equipment.
Most of the region is Chedaki controlled but at some point we'll encounter Russians.
Which I doubt...
Not that we stand much chance against the Russians as it is...
Right, right. You're the boss. Pogorevka is just north east of here. Let's go.
Hey enough of the lectures, we know our situation. All I need are objectives.
Just tell us where we're needed and we'll be out of your hair, OK?
Hi, Sergeant, I see you met Andrej. Don't worry, he's a good guy, we just always argue about the politics...
Listen up, men! This is sergeant Cooper and his men. In contrary to most of us, they have combat experience, so they'll take command.
Right, right. You're the boss. Novy Sobor is just south west of here. Let's go.
All right, guys. We're up against the local Chedaki garrison. The Russians don't have many patrols in this area, so they shouldn't be too much trouble.
First, we need you to take Novy Sobor. Once it's ours, I will send an APC with comms equipment. Then we set up the base and continue freeing villages to the west.
We have three teams. They're good men, but we are all lightly armed. We have a few technicals as well. Not much, but it will have to be enough.
So, everyone ready? Let's do it! Sergeant Cooper is taking over right now. See you in Sobor, I'm gonna get the command vehicle.
We know they have a checkpoint south of Pogorevka, so at some point, assuming we survive that long...
... we're going to have to make contact.
If the CDF see we've been able to control this area, they may see the value of an alliance after all.
Prizrak is a psycho and you know we need all the help we can get!
Let me tell you, things work differently here. You can't just call a Blackhawk to come rescue you when things get ugly.
Which I doubt...
Bah! No chance! They hate Prizrak too much, and anyway with him on our side who needs the CDF?
Shh! Jesus, you shouldn't say things like that.
We heard you're having some trouble with a guy called Kalverovich. We're here to help.
My name's Cooper. This is Razor Team. Are you in charge here?
OK, do you know what kind of numbers Kalverovich has? Weapons and so on?
Just get your people somewhere safe. We'll set up some defenses and prepare for the assault.
Who are you?
Magnificent! You hear that everyone? Saved at the eleventh hour! We hoped NAPA or even the CDF might help. But who are you? You're not Chernarussian...
Something like that...
I don't know. They've attacked before and it was only dozen or so men with small arms. It could be worse now the fighting has become so fierce.
But I know they'll be here soon! What will you do? Can we help?
OK! Thank you! Thank you! Good luck!
Ugh, no problem. The shape we're in?
We'll talk to them immediately, private.
Hey, it's you! Damn, are you OK?
You need to stay out of the fighting from now on. They'll need your evidence when all this is over.
That's good. The Russians and Chedaki are being forced back, CDF activity in the south is helping a lot.
That's good. We're pushing back the Russians and Chedaki, but NAPA's activities are helping us a lot.
Well, things change my friend. We've got to press on, keep things moving. You'll be OK?
No problem.
Easy, easy, we're friends, are you OK?
Yeah sorry, what happened?
Russians did this to you? Not Chedaki?
Deja vu...
Sounds like they had a run-in with the Russian who got Simmons guys.
Sorry. We've heard of this Karelin guy before. He got some friends of ours in the same way.
He mentioned Lopotev by name?
Shit we got 'em guys. They reckon Lopotev is working with the Russians through Karelin, the blond guy.
Razor? Man is it good to see you!
Hold on Martin, I'll be right back.
Yeah, we'll take care of us now. Thanks again.
The Russians caught us. We were trying to retake the city, flush them out.
Well, they were in uniform. Some blond bastard named Karelin was in charge. He was just about to knife us all in cold blood when you attacked the city!
What?
Yes he obviously knew him personally.
We're going to stay here and help run things for NAPA. We need leaders now, real organisation.
We're heading up to a NAPA safehouse to help run things. We need leaders now, real organisation.
It's true, the CDF will never help us with people like Prizrak in charge.
That's revolution for you Zbyshek.
Sergeant Cooper, the Chedaki were holding some NAPA captives in Novy Sobor. They're all pretty messed up. Will you come? They want to talk to an officer.
Hmm, pretty stupid question...
He was just going to stab us one after the other! He said so himself! I thought we were finished for sure. Honza's in bad shape Michal, but he'll live.
He was a madman! Kept raving about Lopotev being too soft!
What? You're surprised they are in on this together?
If we could get support from the CDF we could secure the whole region. We're all ready to cooperate, to join forces, but the CDF won't accept us.
Things are moving so fast, it got out of control so quickly.
Don this is Razor, Pogorevka is ours Sir.
Skreesh this is Razor, can you hear me? Over.
Copy that Skreesh, we'll rendezvous with you at point Oranges, Razor out.
One more reason to finish him off quickly then huh? Come on we've gotta RV with Skreesh at point Oranges.
LittleJohn this is Razor, Novy Sobor is ours Sir.
Sherwood this is Razor, are you with us? Over.
Copy that Sherwood, we'll rendezvous with you at point Hood, Razor out.
One more reason to finish him off quickly then huh? Come on we've gotta RV with Sherwood at point Hood.
Razor this is Don, excellent work. Your APC is en route. You should be able to contact them directly, callsign 'Skreesh'.
I'm placing them under your command now Razor, good luck. Don out.
Razor this is Skreesh, hear you loud and clear, we're inbound to Pogorevka now, over.
Razor this is LittleJohn, excellent work. Your APC is en route. You should be able to contact them directly, callsign 'Sherwood'.
I'm placing them under your command now Razor, good luck. Little John out.
Yeah Robo, you're the one who's hot for black ops...
Yeah Robo, you're the one who's hot for black ops...
Huh, that's gratitude for ya', 'Hey, excellent work Razor! Now clean my boots!' Jesus...
Yeah well I just want some recognition, we're kicking the bear in the nuts here.
Huh, that's gratitude for ya', 'Hey, excellent work Razor! Now clean my boots!' Jesus...
Yeah well I just want some recognition, we're kicking the bear in the nuts here.
Aw... Wanna cookie?
Aw... Wanna cookie?
Razor this is Sherwood, hear you loud and clear, we're inbound to Novy Sobor, over.
Let me through! Let me talk to them.
Get you out of this mess god willing!
People, listen to me! You must be calm!
People! OK! That's fine! Fight if you want!
Fight I say! Go ahead! Go and take on the Russians and their allies. I'll make sure I save plenty of space for you all in my graveyard...
If you radicalize then you've already lost. This land is filled with dead soldiers already, do you really want to join them?
Like what? How many of you know how to shoot eh? How many of you could shoot a man even if you had the chance?
Listen to me, be reasonable. Let these soldiers do the fighting, it's what they do. You should go home, rebuild what you can of your lives and let that be your fight. Isn't that enough?
I don't need any more dead accountants and farmers. I'd like to have something of a congregation left when all this is over.
These soldiers just got rid of the Russians for you! Come on!
Look just back off OK? We need to get through here.
Great, now the padre wants a piece. What can you do Father?
Father!
Hey nice work, thanks Father. That was something else.
Get out of here! No more soldiers! Out! Out! Out!
Yes, and we don't want more uniforms replacing them! More guns!
We won't let you run around like you own the place! We're sick of it! You'll have to go through me first!
Listen Father we've had Chedaki, Marines, CDF, Russians and now bloody NAPA through here! They've all done nothing but cause pain!
Listen Father we've had Chedaki, CDF and Marines through here, bloody Russians knocking on the door and now the CDF back again! We've had enough!
The only shot you ever took was a measles injection Jon...
Come on you idiot! This isn't achieving anything! We should be out fighting! Getting rid of the enemy ourselves!
Well at least give these men a chance! I say... We should be helping them! Teach those Russian bastards a lesson!
People like you did nothing before and will do nothing this time either! I say we should help NAPA! Teach those Russian bastards a lesson!
We have to do something! Father!
Hey I can shoot!
Don this is Razor, we've taken Rogovo, out.
Don this is Razor, we've taken Stary Sobor, out.
Don this is Razor, we've taken Novy Sobor, over.
LittleJohn this is Razor, we've taken Rogovo, out.
LittleJohn this is Razor, we've taken Stary Sobor, out.
LittleJohn this is Razor, we've taken Nový Sobor, over.
The city is ours? Then the CDF now control the whole region! From here we can free all Chernarus!
We'll take a few days to consolidate our gains. After that we're in a strong position to drive the enemy out.
I can't thank you enough. You've achieved more than we dared hope for. Tomorrow the work begins in earnest!
The city is ours? Then NAPA now control of the whole region! From here we can free all Chernarus!
We'll take a few days to consolidate our gains. After that we're in a strong position to drive the enemy out.
I can't thank you enough. You've achieved more than we dared hope for. Get some rest Razor Team. Tomorrow the work begins in earnest!
Well, we didn't do it alone.
The city is ours! NAPA now control the whole region. From here we can free all Chernarus!
This is your victory Marines!
I was about to say the same thing!
Be reasonable. Neither of us can do this alone. Not with the Russians here.
Prizrak is dead. But we were never terrorists. NAPA wants a free country. Nothing more, nothing less. We want to prove that.
Uh copy that, this is Karel. I see a NAPA unit fifty to your right...
Vaclav? I thought the Chedaki got you weeks ago? How are on the radio? What's going on?
Is that you waving? Yes! I see you! You're with NAPA?
Shit sorry. Vaclav, pull you're men back, draw them over to our machine guns, OK?
Vaclav? is that you? It's Karel from the village! Vaclav!
You're using our channel Karel! It was us firing! It's my unit!
Roger that! Go for it!
The city is ours! The CDF now control the whole region. From here we can free all Chernarus!
This is your victory Razor Team!
True. It was good to see our forces working together.
Indeed. If only all your organization were this cooperative...
What do you suggest? Your leadership is unacceptable. We cannot be seen to condone terrorist actions.
A free country is something we all want my friend. Perhaps, finally, this is our chance to build it?
This is Mafia. Who's firing on my corner, don't think they're our guns. Can anyone confirm over?
Uh, do you guys want to have this little reunion off air?
This is Longbow. Who's firing on my corner, don't think they're our guns. Can anyone confirm over?
Uh, do you guys wanna do this little reunion off air?
Karel? Is that you? It's Vaclav! Karel!
We must be using the same channel. It was us firing! You can see me?
Roger that! Moving!
Uh copy that, this is Vaclav. Yeah I'm looking at them now, you've got a CDF unit fifty to your right.
Karel? How are on the radio? What's going on?
Is that you waving? Yes! I see you!
Shit sorry. Karel get ready, I'll pull my men back, draw them over to your machine guns, OK?
Head's up guys! Incoming!
I can see that! Guys, come on!
That's it, they're running away, pour it on 'em! Don't quit now.
This is hopeless. Fall back! We've lost the village. I say again, fall back! It's over!
Cooper! They're coming! Kalverovich is here! I can see them to the south!
Cooper they're breaking through! Help!
Kalverovich is down! We got him! We got him! Die you bastard!
Sure we'll help. What village?
It's no problem, I'm a regular Chris Adams.
Yeah, 'Western'. Cowboy... Cowboys, Indians, you know? Ah forget it.
Thank you! You won't regret it! We're from Vishnoye.
No no! Sorry. It's a Western thing...
Western..?
Your name is Chris Adams?
Sorry pal, we can't spare the time. We've got a war to win here.
Oh I see. Then we are dead men. Come on let's get out of here.
I heard about this Chris Adams guy who might help...
That's close enough friend, what do you want?
We need you to help us...
He's a thief!
He and his men are planning to attack our village.
There's this man Kalverovich...
A murderer!
Steal our food!
Will you help us?
Prizrak is a good man and an excellent fighter, I just haven't met him yet.
Without him we'd be all dead by now.
Sorry, can you tell me more about that Prizrak guy? Means „Ghost" right?
Who is Prizrak?
He's been a NAPA military commander since the civil war. Quite a capable guy, but a bit of an extremist.
His identity is unknown but well protected.
Uh, we're gonna kill Prizrak, right?
Copy that Sir, we're on our way. Razor out.
Uh... Copy that Razor team! Christ! I will tell Yidash to expect you at 072-083, I know NAPA have a camp there that he feels safe using. OK?
Uh yeah, sorry, I think we must have got our wires crossed there Captain. We were just interested in Prizrak, that's all.
No problem at all Cooper, you are still marines after all. Call me if you need anything else. Consigliere out.
Well, that's three down, we're making progress.
It's this Prizrak guy who's the real problem. Everyone keeps talking about him.
Yeah I know. That's what worries me...
I'll run it past Captain Marny, see what CDF intel think about the idea.
Consigliere this is Razor, message over.
Hey Marny, what's the deal with this guy Prizrak? We keep hearing what a pain in the ass he is, over.
Oh, just interested is all, sir. Seems like a bit of a thorn in everyone's side if you know what I mean Sir.
We thought perhaps if he were out of the way...? Over.
Razor this is Consigliere, it's good to hear from you again Sergeant Cooper. Go ahead over.
Well, we only have the name. He's something of a talisman for NAPA we think. Early driving force in the resistance.
More recently he's been forced to the radical fringes of the organization. Too senior to ignore but too crazy for most NAPA personnel.
Why ask? Over.
That's not a suggestion to throw around lightly Sergeant Cooper. But it has been considered.
Look, I have a... colleague shall we say? A contact inside NAPA. We both deal in intrigue, you understand?
He might be able to slake your thirst for knowledge about old Prizrak.
His name is Yidash. If you want I can let him know you're coming. He knows all about the man, I think he could even write his obituary...
But Razor, are you sure you want to do this? Maybe we are making some horrible translation mistake?
Yeah but it'd be a hell of a lot easier if NAPA would get their damn house in order. We're all fighting the same enemies here. I wish they'd just fall in.
Jesus Randy!
You shouldn't joke about that stuff.
You can't be serious Coops?
Oh for the love of god...
Oh subtle...
That's the radical spirit for you man, those guys are freedom fighters, psycho extremists come with the territory.
He might have a point Cooper.
Well why don't we just take him out of the picture then?
What? It solves the problem right? Just get me in range...
Who's joking?
Don this is Razor, we taken Rogovo, out.
Don this is Razor, we taken Stary Sobor, out.
Don this is Razor, we taken Novy Sobor, out.
Thank you sir, how're things going elsewhere?
Maybe we should try to bring them in as allies sir? NAPA I mean. Offer logistical support and so on?
LittleJohn this is Razor, we taken Rogovo, out.
LittleJohn this is Razor, we taken Stary Sobor, out.
LittleJohn this is Razor, we taken Pogorevka, over.
Thank you sir, how're things going elsewhere?
Maybe we should try to ally ourselves to them sir? The CDF I mean. Request logistical support and so on?
Razor this is Don, fantastic! You're certainly living up to that reputation! I'm impressed.
Better than expected! It helps that the Russians are having problems in the north. NAPA are making some gains around Gorka that're keeping them occupied.
That's always been the dilemma for us Sergeant. I agree we need NAPA's help to win this. What's happening around Gorka is a perfect example.
But it's just not going to happen with radicals like Prizrak leading their organization, we couldn't allow it. By all accounts the man's a monster, as bad or worse than the Chedaki.
Anyway, radio discipline! Carry on the good work Razor Team, Don out.
Razor this is LittleJohn, fantastic! You're certainly living up to your reputation marine! I'm impressed.
Better than expected! Chedaki are having problems down south. The CDF are making some gains around Zelenogorsk that're keeping them occupied.
That's always been the dilemma for us Sergeant. It's clear we need The CDF's help to win this. What's happening around Zelenogorsk is a perfect example.
But it won't happen while people like Prizrak will be in charge of our organization, the CDF couldn't allow it. They can't stomach what Prizrak must do sometimes.
Anyway, radio discipline! Carry on the good work Razor Team, LittleJohn out.
What's going on Fyodor? What are you doing here?
You're Prizrak.
Don't worry, it's not the kind of thing I'll be filing in a report to my Captain...
I didn't wanna hear it. Come on let's get out of here. We've still got a city to take.
Yeah. Hope we did the right thing.
Copy that.
Razor Team to Yidash, message over.
Sorry Yidash we can't do it. We're still marines. My team won't murder in cold blood.
I didn't wanna hear it. Come on let's get out of here. We've still got a city to take.
Right, where you murder and torture people.
No, you're the problem. You're destroying Chernarus Fyodor or Prizrak or whoever the hell you are.
The CDF need NAPA's support to win this war and you're in the way.
What the fuck has Stalin got to do with anything? There are other ways to get the Russian soldiers out. We're working on it. We just need time!
Had to be done Scarlet. I know you're not happy with this.
Copy that.
Razor Team to Yidash, message over.
Yeah it's done. I hope it was worth it Yidash.
Ah, Razor Team! I didn't think they'd send you. The Lord works in mysterious ways, his wonders etc. etc...
Keep your enemies closer, yes? I was expecting grubby assassins Sergeant Cooper, not United States Marines. Yidash surprises me.
Nonsense! The CDF are useless! You know this yourself! They couldn't handle things when it was just the Chedaki and now you think they can beat the Russians too? Madness!
Chernarus must be free from all Russians. Settler and soldier alike. We must have our country back! Stalin sent them here and I will send them back!
I will not allow the gains NAPA have made to be squandered by fools in the CDF. There will be no alliance while I am alive!
So make your choice Sergeant Cooper. I have work to do.
I am whoever I must be to make NAPA strong Sergeant. I built this organization, so I am bound to lead it.
The Lord is my shepherd, yes? And so people are like sheep. They need to be guided.
But it is easier if you are also the wolf, you understand?
In the end, fear is the only real motivator. Even as a priest you deal in fear, people listen because they are afraid.
So I am both the carrot and the stick, yes? Fyodor standing in the light, and Prizrak lurking in the shadow.
Bah! This is not the west Sergeant Cooper! Things are different here, real, complicated. You see things too simply.
I am the one who is saving this country! I provide spiritual and military strength!
I am a leader! A symbol of Chernarussian resistance! I am Chernarus! And now you want to destroy it?
Well, that was weird.
No, no it's OK. I'm fine with it, really. We crossed the fucking Rubicon a long time ago.
That was close.
Sure we did. There's crossing the Rubicon and then there's murder Coops.
You're the one talking about darkness and light asshole!
You'd better call Yidash and let him know it's done.
You'd better call Yidash and let him know we changed our minds.
Uh... Hello Razor, this is Yidash. Uh, is it done? Over.
Fantastic! Now we must keep this quiet. No one can know we planned this! It could jeopardize the alliance.
Then we understand each other. Razor I'm very proud of wha...
Uh... Hello Razor, this is Yidash. Uh, is it done? Over.
My god! You cowards! Do you know what you've done? Razor this means de..
Hell, we're so far down the rabbit hole that this almost makes sense. OK, where is he?
No problem. We're on it.
Excellent! He's at the sawmill north of Vishnoye. He uses it to... well you can't imagine. But he won't stay for long. Will you go now?
Sorry, we can't do it.
It's not our problem, Yidash.
What? I was told you had more courage than this! Have you made me speak out for nothing? Don't you know what a risk this was?
It will be your problem when the Russians and the Chedaki take control! Gah, you disgust me, get out of my sight!
Yidash?
Calm down, we're friends.
Do what?
Right, sorry. Just wanted to make sure we were on the same page here.
What? Slow down, noone said anything about that.
Assassinate Prizrak?
Shh! Wait.
Can you see? Are we being watched?
We just want our country back. As long as Prizrak's around we can have no alliance with the CDF and no alliance means no country for us.
So will you do it?
Shh! Yes, yes dammit!
Don't look around! Jesus...
Hold on a second.
OK. You really ready to do this?
Jesus you're going to make me say it... Kill Prizrak!
Come on! You've seen what it's like out there. If we can unite the CDF and NAPA we might have a chance.
Alone, both parties will perish, it's clear. Prizrak is the only thing in... in our way.
The man's an extremist! He's murdered and tortured as much as any Chedaki. Ask anyone and you'll see it in their eyes.
No one likes the Chedaki, but not all of us want to see them or their Russian settlers tortured. We're not monsters.
No thanks Hastrman, we're doing fine on our own.
Oh? Well suit yourselves marines. Hope you don't get shot now! Good luck!
Yeah OK, deal. We can use all the help we can get. Here's our frequency.
Don't worry about that, I'd shoot you all before it got that far...
Excellent! I'll be in touch. Hope you don't get shot now! Good luck!
You think that's what happens when you're out here too long?
What? Dude seemed all right to me...
Halt, who goes there? Friend or foe.
Don't fuck me around pal, what are you doing out here? Advance and be recognized!
You shouldn't be out hunting right now Hastrman, it's not safe.
Aha, you a guerilla scout or something?
OK McMurphy calm down...
Sorry Hastrman, we can't be responsible for your safety.
Friend or foe is it? Friendly foe!
Nice to see you friendly foes! My name is Hastrman. I'm just poor hunter, of sorts. And you, you are Marines!
Yes I know! I see you. I see everything!
For the men I hunt maybe yes!
Is good sport up here at moment, isn't it? You smell them?
I only shoot them sometimes though. Fair's fair. Sometimes I just watch them marching around. One, two, three in row.
HAHA! I like you Marines! I share the sport with you, what do you say? We hunt together!
Bah! As if I go with you noisy marines! No! I mean I tell you about prey I'm stalking. Understand? Tell you where when I see them. Yes?
We've already have a scout/sniper, thanks...
Contact. One guy, doesn't look like a regular.
Well he's not firing... I'll take that as a good sign.

Central Chernarus liberated

NAPA managed to liberate a significant part of central Chernarus. Angry with the Chedaki failures, Russian pressure is now likely to increase. Having rebelled against their new masters, the CDF also had some minor gains near Zelenogorsk. While it's true that the enemy of my enemy is my friend, it's unfortunate that a more formal alliance was not achieved.
Civil Disorder

Razor's failure to establish any significant gains in the region with alacrity have resulted in Civil disorder. The region is in chaos, tying up our forces and preventing any serious pressure from being applied to the OPFOR. Without coherency, the deployed forces will most likely surrender or worse devolve into criminality under the command of local warlords.
KIA

A member of Razor Team was killed in action. This is unacceptable in the current situation. US forces are not supposed to be present in Chernarus. As a result Razor Team were declared deserters and abandoned. Mission canceled.
Central Chernarus liberated

The CDF managed to liberate a significant part of central Chernarus. Angry with the Chedaki failures, Russian pressure is now likely to increase. The NAPA organization also had some minor gains near Gorka, causing our enemies further trouble in that region. The enemy of my enemy is my friend, but a more formal alliance cannot be entered into while NAPA harbour extremists.
Central Chernarus liberated

NAPA managed to liberate a significant part of central Chernarus. Moreover, thanks to the timely death of the radical Prizrak the CDF are able to enter into an alliance with NAPA. Together our chances to drive Russians out have increased from none to slim. United we stand...
Central Chernarus liberated

The CDF managed to liberate a significant part of central Chernarus. Moreover, thanks to the timely death of the radical Prizrak the CDF are able to enter into an alliance with NAPA. Together our chances to drive Russians out have increased from none to slim. United we stand...
Razor base destroyed
Razor team's main base was destroyed by OPFOR. Our chance to liberate the Sobor region is lost. If our forces have failed to take and hold this region, there is no hope for further resistance.

Mission Plan

Officially, the USMC are no longer in Chernarus. Unoffically, Razor Team remain as deniable covert operatives. Razor must support their host organization, fighting alongside them to achieve objectives as ordered by their assigned commander. Beyond that, Razor should monitor the situation in Chernarus, gather intelligence and await further instruction from USEUCOM. Above all else the goal is a stable, independent Chernarus. Razor must strive to accomplish this desirable outcome by any means possible.
Badlands
We've been assigned as deniable covet operatives to Chernarussian fighters. Let's make ourselves a valued asset.

Although the USMC is no longer officially present in Chernarus, Razor Team remain as covert operatives. Razor is to lead a small unit of Chernarussian fighters and eliminate Chedaki forces in the Sobor region. The Russians are considered aggressors here, backing the Chedaki. However, their direct combat actions against us are sporadic.

Advance to the first settlement and capture it. A mobile headquarters APC will arrive to establish an operating base afterwards. Use all available resources and units to capture the remaining objectives. Direct action against Russian forces is to be avoided if possible as they have avoided engaging us so far.

So...
Tell me...
NOW!
Give me what I want! Where is the comms station? Valery? Valery?
Ah shit, he fucking croaked... Well, that's Chedaki for you...
I guess that's that. You'd better get out of here. I'll clean this up. Thanks anyway Cooper.

Where are you Chedaki receiving your orders from, eh? Where's your main communications base? Speak!

Yes. I am Valery Pavelka...

Shaftoe's gonna love this...

Little John's gonna love this...
Razor Team! Come, look at this.
You're man is correct, they were Spetsnaz.

Clear!

You double-crossing assholes!

What's happening?

Aha! Our American fighting friends! I don't know Razor, every time I see you now I don't know whether to hug you or hide!
I hope you haven't changed your minds about me now have you?
Hey it's our American heroes! You're doing some amazing work Razor Team! Honestly, I might draft you in as my personal bodyguard!
You know Yidash tried to have me killed yesterday? Well, he won't be doing that again, but his dogs are still out there Razor. Gives me the shivers to think about them eh?!
Uh yeah, we knew that...
Well dodn't you feel cheated by him? Deceived? Don't you want justice?

Marny, you Spooks are really crazy, you know that?

Oh. Yeah? Uh, what happened?
Yidash tried to kill him?
Sure thing Tuck. We'll keep our eyes open. No problem...
Hey, I see where this is going. We had nothing to do with it, he asked us to kill Prizrak and we refused, OK?

What!? No, you're kidding?

We didn't want any part of your cloak and dagger assassinations last time and we still don't.
What does it matter? Fyodor is Prizrak, what's that got to do with anything?!

Well don't you feel cheated by him? Deceived? Don't you want justice?
Killing him will bring finally bring NAPA into line, can't you see that?
We've been given a second chance. A legitimate chance. Why not take it?

Cooper, come and see me at the base. It's important. Out.
The fucking liberals in NAPA would love that. They'd have us bowing and scraping to the CDF in no time if Prizrak was out of the picture.
I want you to keep an ear to the ground for me. Let me know if you find hear anything suspicious, OK?
Ah you're here. Good. Listen, I found out why Yidash was killed...
Cooper that fucking turncoat tried to have Prizrak assassinated! Prizrak told me so himself!
No! Have him killed. Prizrak didn't tell me who the assassin was. I guess he either doesn't know or he's protecting them, he won't say.
But I want the bastards found! Who knows... They could try it again!
The fucking liberals in NAPA would love that. They'd have us bowing and scraping to the CDF in no time if Prizrak was out of the picture.
I want you to keep an ear to the ground for me. Let me know if you find hear anything suspicious, OK?

But Yidash wasn't the only one who did. Other weak minded fools might try again.
This is Razor, go ahead over.
Marny, you said there was word from USEUCOM?
Marny we've talked about this before!
We tried once, we just couldn't go through with it...

But even if the guy confesses everything the Russians could say otherwise. Hell, they might already know about Karelin, Loptev and the whole damn setup! It might have been their idea dammit!
Copy that sir. We're on our way. Razor Team Out.
Copy that sir. We're on our way. Razor Team Out.

Flawless Victory

We managed to eliminate the 'Chedaki' insurgency. We also managed to drive the Russians back, mainly thanks to the evidence we gathered on the 'Chedaki' - testimonies, photographs, items, recordings, etc. The Russian's didn't want to see the Red Star movement for what it was, but couldn't deny the weight of evidence.
Bitter Victory

Although we managed to convince the Russians about the true nature of the 'Chedaki' Red star movement, we weren't able to win in the military sense. It's not ideal but at least the Kremlin now understands that supporting the Chedaki was a mistake.
Defeat
The operation was a catastrophe. We failed to achieve military success and we also failed to convince the Russian forces that the 'Chedaki' are the real threat. The future of Chernarus is grim.
Bitter Victory
The operation was a success, not only did we drive the 'Chedaki' out but we also made the Russian's run like hell back to Moscow - we didn't even have to present them with any evidence!

There is a ChDKZ main base somewhere in Chernarus which serves as their chief logistical hub for troops, vehicles and key insurgency commanders. Your task is to locate it and orchestrate an attack which will neutralise the base, preferably reducing it to a heap of smoldering rubble.
United We Stand

Your primary objective is to retake territory held by the Russian armed forces and the Chedaki. Our goal is nothing less than to take control of The Chernarussian Republic. We need you to capture all cities in the northern province.
Capture all objectives

Valery Pavelka, our 'Chedaki' POW claims he has some valuable information for us. He wants protection. Deliver him safely to our main base where he's promised to provide the information in exchange for a guarantee of safety.
Transfer important POW
Destroy ChDKZ base

According to Valery Pavelka, there's a secret ChDKZ HQ located on an island south east of the Cernarussian coast. Some radio signals indicate the same location. Pavelka claims this is the hiding place of the senior Chedaki commander. Your task is to investigate the source of the radio signals.
Check location
INVESTIGATE

Lopotev is our highest priority POW. The Russians are as keen as we are to interrogate him so they've sent some intelligence officers to assist you in transferring 'The Shark'. The officers should be ready in a few minutes at a nearby location. Lopotev must be safely transferred to the exchange point ASAP without coming to any harm. Rendezvous with the Russian intel officers who'll then lead you to the handover.
Transfer Lopotev
POW

The Russians have a main base near Vybor airport which serves as their chief logistical hub for troops, vehicles and key insurgency commanders. Your task is to locate it and orchestrate an attack which will neutralise the base, preferably reducing it to a heap of smouldering rubble.
Destroy Russian base
Background

The union between CDF and NAPA forces has significantly degraded Russian attitudes toward the CDF. For now the Russians seem to be holding positions, supporting the 'Chedaki' and waiting for us to make the mistake of directly attacking them. The Chernarussian nation stands united however.
Intel: Russians

The Russians seem to be holding the positions they assumed on 16. October 2007 while the ChDKZ do all the dirty work. The Russians are extremely powerful but also politically vulnerable. If we were able to present them and the global media with evidence of 'Chedaki' atrocities the Russians might be forced to reconsider their involvement in Chernarussian crisis. Cpt. Marny will give you more details on this. You can find him near your MHQ.
Intel: USMC

The Americans weren't happy about leaving Chernarus to the Russians. Clearly they would like to return to the fight, something confirmed by Razor's covert presence. Several factors prevent this though. First, stronger evidence is needed to prove Chedaki war crimes and their involvement with the Moscow bombing. Second, we need to make some significant territorial gains. For more information on this talk to Maj. R.A. Stavovich.

We are now engaged in a full scale war with the 'Chedaki' and their Russian allies. The Russians seem to be backing the 'Chedaki', but have taken no ground beyond their initial positions as yet. We will try to avoid attacking them and see how the situation develops. Even so, we must push all OPFOR units out of Chernarus. The radical elements in NAPA remain a worry. If they attack directly they could draw the Russians in. USMC command has covertly indicated they may re-enter the war, but only if enough evidence if found to highlight 'Chedaki' atrocities. The difficult task now facing us is to liberate the whole of Chernarus.

The Americans weren't happy about leaving Chernarus to the Russians. Clearly they would like to return to the fight, something confirmed by Razor's covert presence. Several factors prevent this though. First, stronger evidence is needed to prove Chedaki war crimes and their involvement with the Moscow bombing. Second, we need to make some significant territorial gains. For more information on this talk to Maj. R.A. Stavovich.

We are now engaged in a full scale war with the 'Chedaki' and their Russian allies. The CDF are also in the fight, hoping the Russians will leave well alone. This is a vain hope. The Russians will inevitably become involved. Not forgetting, elements of their forces also want us dead. We may have to fight them both. Hopefully the CDF will not turn against us as we have a common enemy. There is still some hope that the US will rejoin the fight. USMC command has covertly indicated they may re-enter the war, but only if enough evidence if found to highlight 'Chedaki' atrocities. The difficult task now facing us is to liberate the whole of Chernarus.

The Russians seem to be holding the positions they assumed on 16. October 2007 while the ChDKZ do all the dirty work. The Russians are extremely powerful but also politically vulnerable. If we were able to present them and the global media with evidence of 'Chedaki' atrocities the Russians might be forced to reconsider their involvement in Chernarussian crisis. 'Tuck' will give you more details on this. You can find him near your MHQ.

Chernogorsk is the capital of the northern province. We need to capture it before USMC forces can redeploy. This is both a political gesture - we need crowds of Chernarussians in the streets welcoming marines back - and a logistic imperative.
Capture Chernogorsk
Deal with Russians
CHERNOGORSK

The Russians have a camp near Krasnostav airport, which serves as the main base for their troops, yard for their vehicles and base of operations for their commanders. BLUFOR command have formulated a plan to rid us of these dubious peacekeepers by political means. It will be all but impossible to defeat them militarily, so this plan should at least be given a chance. Ltn. Tomas Marny has some deeper insight into this.

In order for the CDF and NAPA to cooperate, the radical Prizrak must be eliminated. He should be located near NAPA's main base. Find him and kill him. The assassination must have the appearance of enemy fire, if you're seen killing Prizrak, no alliance will be possible.
I'm outta here...
I'm staying...
Hey go easy man...
Fuck him up man!
Dogs Of War
Word from USEUCOM?
What's up?
Yes, we knew that.
No, you're kidding?
After initial success there's no turning back. Winner takes all. Whole Chernarus is the prize.

Due to CDF and NAPA forces uniting, Russian relations with the CDF have degraded significantly. The Russians seem to be holding their positions for now, supporting the Chedaki and waiting for us to make the mistake of directly attacking them. The Chernarussian nation stands united and USMC command has indicated that if we find enough evidence of Chedaki atrocities and are holding Chernagorsk, they can re-enter the war. The daunting task ahead is to entirely liberate the Northern Province of Chernarus.

A full scale war with the Chedaki and their Russian friends has begun. We cannot step back; it's them or us now! We have to fight until they leave the Northern Province or we are all eliminated. USMC command has indicated that if we find enough evidence of Chedaki atrocities and are holding Chernagorsk, they can re-enter the war.

A full scale war with the Chedaki and their Russian friends has begun. We cannot step back; it's them or us now! We have to fight until they leave the Northern Province or we are all eliminated. USMC command has indicated that if we find enough evidence of Chedaki atrocities and are holding Chernagorsk, they can re-enter the war.

It will rapidly become clear if we've gathered enough evidence to convince the Russians to leave. If not and they decide to stay, we should beat the Chedaki forces into submission before attacking the Russians. Hopefully the USMC will be able to re-deploy.

It will rapidly become clear if we've gathered enough evidence to convince the Russians to leave. If not and they decide to stay, we should beat the Chedaki forces into submission before attacking the Russians. Hopefully NAPA radicals won't lure the Russians into combat.

It will rapidly become clear if we've gathered enough evidence to convince the Russians to leave. If not and they decide to stay, we should beat the Chedaki forces into submission before attacking the Russians. Hopefully the CDF won't attack us - after all, we share a common enemy.

Retake the Northern Province of Chernarus from the OPFOR. The Chedaki have to be eliminated; however, the Russians might be willing to leave if enough evidence is presented to them. Under the right circumstances, the USMC may also redeploy to Chernarus.

Capture all settlements in the Northern Province of Chernarus from the OPFOR. The Chedaki have to be eliminated; however the Russians might be willing to leave if enough evidence is presented to them. Under the right circumstances, the USMC may also redeploy to Chernarus.

Retake the Northern Province of Chernarus from the OPFOR. The Chedaki have to be eliminated; however the Russians might be willing to leave if enough evidence is presented to them. Under the right circumstances, the USMC may also redeploy to Chernarus.

We are on our own now, however all NAPA and CDF resources are at our disposal.
We are on our own now, however all CDF resources are at our disposal.
We are on our own now, however all NAPA resources are at our disposal.
No, it's too much responsibility.
Yes, I will command all units.
Back in Zelenogorsk
Here they are! Let's hear it marines! Razor Team!
Gentlemen I've seen some things in my time but nothing like what you've accomplished.
The Russians will try to play the whole thing down in public, but your service will be remembered where it matters.
Officially, this is the War That Never Was. Unofficially you're my god-damned heroes! I've never been prouder.
Razor's highly irregular involvement in Operation Harvest Red will remain classified at the highest possible level.
So my advice would be to enjoy this celebration marines, revel in the glory of what you've achieved. You saved Chernarus, you defeated the Russians, you united a people.
Now how about I open the brandy and you tell me your best war stories? 'Cos one things for sure:
It's the last time you're ever gonna talk about it...
My country is eternally in your debt Razor Team.
Woohoo! Yeah!
Congratulations Razor! I'm going to personally ensure you all get the Medal of Honor for this. We'll have to fabricate some fictional reason of course...
Dressler! Good to see you!
Right, right, just say I saved your ass from a horde of anti-bullshit militia or something... See you later.
It feels like I need find something else to do on the weekends!
I'm going into politics Razor! NAPA are going to challenge for government!
Michalkov. Valery Michalkov. The next president of Chernarus!
Hey! How's it feel to have a free country?
Oh my god... Well, hey, you're on your own this time Little John... uh... Say, what's you name?
Captain, you have absolutely no idea.
So much for no party...
Well, how does it feel to be going home?
You did an amazing job out there Razor, I can't think of a single event in the corps' history to match your achievements.
I mean you practically saved the whole damned country! It's incredible!
The tragedy is that officially you were never there, hell, if you listen to the Kremlin the war never even happened.
But if I had my way they'd be naming ships after you. Congratulations marines, you made us all proud.
Armstrong's got a little welcoming party arranged for back on board, he's even donated that brandy of his.
It's all for you Razor, you deserve it. Get out there and meet your public marines!
Robo, for once we agree entirely...
What?
ha ha ha
Suck it up marine!
How's this for an idea: Bring on the ticker tape! Bring on the babes! Bring on the fast food man! I haven't had a decent cheeseburger in a month!
Ooh-Rah!
Hey, look at that! The deck's crawling.
So what, we get nothing? After all that? What the fuck!
You gotta be shitting me... What a fucking rip off!
Hah, dream on guys, right Captain?
After all you've done? It was my duty Razor Team. I owe you my country. Thank you Razor.
Perhaps you would consider staying? I need good generals... The Takistan border is always a worry...
Shit there's Stavovich. Hey Don! What're you doing here! Do I still call you Sir?
Uh, think we'll take a week off first Sir, how about you call me Monday!
胜利
You survived your ordeal, liberating a country and embarrassing a former superpower in the process. Nice work marine.
KIA
The war was over for you but the stress was obviously too much. Now was not the time to go for a swim marine...
The Russian government withdrew its forces from Chernarus after receiving conclusive evidence that the Moscow bombing was orchestrated in Russia and executed by 'Chedaki' personnel.
Based on an agreement between the Russian and American governments, all events post the US withdrawal were camouflaged as the 'mistakes of low-level commanders' and dismissed as 'border incidents' .
Sgt. Brian O'Hara stayed in the USMC special forces for some time.
He left the Corps a seasoned combat veteran with 6 years of service in 27th MEU to his name.
He returned to San Francisco and study, becoming a civilian MD some years later.
Sgt. Randolph Sykes was severely wounded during Operation Fiery Mountain.
Following a slow recovery, he became a special warfare instructor at Marine Special Operations School, Camp Lejeune in 2012.
The End
With the help of the Marines, the Chernarussian people were able to quell the local insurgency.
Chernarus is free and well on the road to peace and democracy.
The involvement of Force Reconnaissance Marines inside Chernarus during the Russian occupation remains classified at the highest level.
Sgt. Matthew Cooper's field promotion to Team Leader was made official following Razor's extraction.
After a tour in Takistan he retired from the Corps and became a security consultant for various government agencies.
He frequently travels to Chernarus.
Sgt. Chad Rodriguez was Killed In Action during Operation Fiery Mountain in 2010.
His personal sacrifice in the intense street battles of Zargabad became legendary in the Marine Corps following their involvement in the Takistani conflict.

Immediately following the capture, handover and bungled rescue attempt of Lopotev the Russian forces are thrown into disarray. Later, the Russian Duma commission a special investigation. The final report tries to play down the 'border dispute' that briefly threatened to bring the Federation into total war with its neighbour and its relations with the west to new post-cold-war low. Chastened, the Kremlin are left apologizing for 'renegade commanders' citing 'terrorist conspiracy' as justification for their actions. The crisis in Chernarus is over. There is still a long way to go to before the country can be called a truly peaceful democracy, but all the preconditions are in place. The 27th MEU remain inside Chernarus, helping the CDF mop up and rebuild. After a long and surreal campaign, Razor Team transfer back to Khe Sanh and then home.

You are being transferred to the Khe Sanh after successfully leading a rebel army to regain control of Chernarus. There's probably some kind of celebration planned, but all you really want is that shower...

It's hard not to be able to talk about it, but those of us who were there will always know. For us, it was all out war, not some slavic skirmish over borders and leadership. For all the people we met and lost and despite this great thing we achieved, I can never tell my friends or family what happened. But enough people do know, and it seems we're all being well rewarded for our silence, so I can't be too unhappy. But to be honest, all I want now is a shower...
Get a shower
War That Never Was
Total Victory! The Russians have left, Chernarus is back under CDF control, Razor are going home.

After the capture, handover and bungled rescue attempt of Lopotev, Russian forces have been thrown into disarray. Peace is re-established and Chedaki conspirators are considered the only threat now by both sides. Razor is being transferred to the Khe Sanh. The details of the campaign are now considered top secret.
UH-60S Seahawk will transfer you to the Khe Sanh.
Return to the Khe Sanh for debriefing.
Russian forces are withdrawing; USMC, CDF and NAPA are eliminating the last remnants of Chedaki resistance.
Logistics support - 1x UH-60S Seahawk.
Returning to the Khe Sanh at last...
Gentlemen please! Cooper is right. We've got to get out of here. The Chedaki are all over the north.
Our only chance is to get to the south coast road, head through Elektrozavodsk and west into central Chernarus.
Calm down Robo. That doesn't matter. We've gotta focus on what we do now.
I can't believe it got so fucked so quickly!
What the hell happened? They just started coming from everywhere!
It must've been those fucking Russians! They screwed us! They've been backing the Chedaki all along!
Anywhere but here...
Bullshit. Shagarov was there man, you saw it. We all saw it...
Sergeant Cooper, there is a harbor in Elektrozavodsk. Maybe we can take a boat?
Sergeant Cooper! The road is covered in Chedaki!
There is a harbor in Elektrozavodsk. Hmm.. Maybe we can take a boat?
Too risky. If they're this far south now they'll be shipping in gear 24/7. Shit! Shit, shit, shit.
All right, let's do it.
Too risky. If they're this far south now they'll be shipping in gear 24/7. Shit! Shit, shit, shit.
All right, let's do it.
Think we can wait them out? Maybe sneak past after they've gone?
Think we can wait them out? Maybe sneak past after they've gone?
Sounds good to me Coops...
Sounds good to me Coops...
Shit! There's Chedaki all over the road guys.
Razor! We are under fire! Shit! Man down! Man down!
We're dropping like flies here Razor!
Razor? We just lost another man.
Razor, shit! Man down!
Razor they're all dead! I... I'm the only one left..!
There's a small harbour on the north east outskirts of town. Usually people dock here instead but...
We're not coming with you Cooper.
We've got family to look out for. Besides, you barely have room...
Just go Cooper! There is no time!
You too! Now go on! Get going!
Anyone got any ideas?
If there's any chance I'll take it.
All right everyone hop in, we're getting out of here.
Bullshit, we'll get you in...
All right, it's your choice. You watch your ass...
We're fucked now man! Totally fucked!
That's gotta be the harbor over there. Let's check it out.
All right! That's the ship! Let's go guys!
Damn! The ship is wasted! We're not going anywhere in that.
Contact! Chedaki here guys! Shall we take 'em?
Wait, stop the truck! There are tanks on the main road, we're not going through that! Everyone out, move!
We must make our way to the harbor! There must be some ships! Move!
Wait, stop the truck! There are tanks on the main road, we're not going through that! Všichni ven, rychle!
Zkusíme se prostřílet do přístavu, musej tam bejt lodě. Makejte!
Cooper, if we can't get through I don't know what else to suggest...
Then we'd better get through, huh? This is our last chance guys, let's do it.
So are we...
All right everyone on board now! We may only have a few minutes.
OK is that everyone? Gun it! Let's go!
There's the harbor. We made it guys...
Contact. The Chedaki are all over this area.
That's it! That's all of 'em! Harbor secure guys!
No! Fuck! The ship's toast! The ship's a fucking wreck! It's dead in the water...
胜利

You managed to escape and eventually reached central Chernarus. Now Razor must decide whether to return to the USA or join the CDF in planning a new offensive against the Chedaki that will be launched in the spring.
Failure
You could not find any means of escape. After some considerable time the Chedaki tracked you down. Razor Team were eliminated.
Chernarussian forces suffered a terrible defeat and were pushed to the southwest.
The Northern Province suffered more than a year of occupation and control by ChDKZ separatists.
Chernarussian forces eventually recaptured the province in 2011 in a bloody and violent epilogue to the Civil War.
A multinational peacekeeping force was installed by the United Nations to stabilize the country, composed mainly of Russian and European forces.
The Russian government suffered a minor crisis in 2009.
Several high-ranking military commanders and politicians faced trial for high treason and were sentenced to death.
General Shagarov received the Order Of Saint Andrew for uncovering the roots of the conspiracy and for capturing 'Akula' Lopotev - he died in a car accident in 2012.
Razor Team successfully exfiltrated the occupied territory and their involvement in the Chernarussian conflict post US withdrawal became a well-kept secret.
None of them ever set foot on Chernarussian soil again.
The End

We're losing ground to Chedaki all over the province. Somehow, they've managed to regroup and drive us out without Russian backing. The CDF are pulling back south west into central Chernarus and what's left of NAPA have gone to ground or were eliminated. Our best chance of survival is to get to the south western coastal highway through Elektrozavodsk. From there we can take some kind of transport out of here.

The coastal highway cutting through Elektrozavodsk is our best, and possibly last, route of escape from the area. The highway heads west from Elektrozavodsk. We must reach it, find some means of transport and head for Central Chernarus. From there we can start to plan a counter-offensive.

What a wasted opportunity! We proved the Chedaki conspiracy behind the Moscow bombing to the Russians. Thanks to Lopotev and Karelin they've pulled out. But somehow the Chedaki still have us on the run. There must still be Reds helping the 'dakis, I know it! There's no other explanation, they can't have just fought harder than us, no way. We've got to get out of here quick. Maybe we can get back to central Chernarus, reunite with CDF, bring in more marines, try something to drive Chedaki back again. Maybe...
Go to second harbor
We managed to get a boat, we can finally leave. Our task now is to sail south east and make land in central Chernarus. We'd better keep far from the shoreline.
Leave Chernarussian waters
AWAY
Intelligence

Elektrozavodsk may be already held by the Chedaki, the whole province is swarming now. Their numbers increase the further north you go, but we can't be completely sure the south coast is safe. We've lost all contact with our intel officers and CoC, so the best we can do is pray.
Reach the highway
HIGHWAY
There's a Chedaki column driving along the coastal highway from the west. It's now impossible to use this route. We've must try to reach the harbor in Elektrozavodsk and look for a boat.
Make it to the harbor
HARBOR
We couldn't find any working ships in the Elektrozavodsk harbor. We know there is one outside Elektrozavodsk - on the north east outskirts. This looks like our last chance to get away.
Setting Sail
Despite the Russian withdrawal we suffered massive losses. There's no hope now. It's time to leave...

We're losing ground to Chedaki all over the province. Somehow they've managed to regroup and drive us out without Russian backing. The CDF are pulling back South West into central Chernarus and what's left of NAPA have gone to ground or were eliminated. We must get to the South Western coastal highway through <marker name="BIS_roadNode_11">Elektrozavodsk</marker>. From there we can arrange some kind of transport.
Reach the highway undercover. Steal, capture or buy a vehicle and move to the Southern province along the <marker name="BIS_highway">SW</marker> highway.
Reach the South Western coastal highway through <marker name="BIS_roadNode_11">Elektrozavodsk</marker>. Find some transport there and get to the <marker name="BIS_highway">SW</marker> of the country.
The Chedaki are all over the country. The CDF and NAPA are unable provide support. We're on our own.
You are on your own.
On the way south to Elektrozavodsk
Doesn't have to be. We just need to find reinforcements and extraction transport here somewhere.
All right, we'll do it...
...get some, guys!
Now
Don't do this son, believe me it won't help you.
So what's your choice? Drop the weapons or end up dead, like your friend in the warehouse did?
Lopotev!
They're gonna get us anyway, Coops.
You fucked this up, bastard...
Motherfucker...Coops, I can get him...I mean it, let's do it...
Calm down Robo. That doesn't matter now. We've got to focus on what we do now.
Will you guys shut the fuck up and listen to me?
Checkpoint Chalice is close. Just past this next village to the east. We're real close now.
We'll call for extraction there and get the hell out of here, OK?
I know I fucked this all up. I'm sorry. But can we just get the fuck out of here? You guys can kick the shit out of me later. Please?
What the fuck's wrong with you? He's right! We've been running for hours! Beaten by fucking 'dakis, man! The Russians are all over the north now too, god knows how we let th...
Fine.
I can't believe it got so fucked so quickly!
What the hell happened? They just started coming from everywhere!
Oh yeah? Well what's that commander? Your leadership's got us pretty fucked so far!
Whatever, let's go...
Hey that's enough marine. What the fuck's wrong with you?
I'm right behind you Cooper.
Damn, I don't like this at all.
Keep cool guys, we've been in worse shit before.
Stay sharp, guys.
Careful, they could be anywhere.
Well ain't this just a pain in the ass?
Are there supposed to be contacts so close to the checkpoint?
Let's move, keep it quiet.
Executed

Not only were you unable to produce enough evidence on the Chedaki atrocities, you also let them defeat you in the field. Your efforts might have made some difference, but not enough to prevent Chernarus falling under totalitarian control.
KIA
A member of Razor team was killed. Deniablity is compromised. Razor will be declared deserters and the mission canceled.
There was nothing to stop the insurgent offensive after the dissolution of forces under Razor Team's command.
Chernarussian troops had to withdraw beyond the boundaries of the Northern Province.
In the following year, the insurgency ended with the total victory of the ChDKZ and 'Akula' Lopotev became countrywide dictator in summer 2010.
Chernarus became a totalitarian regime and its people had little hope for the future.
In 2014, after four years of violent rule, Lopotev was assassinated by an unknown killer at his summer villa in Chernogorsk.
It changed nothing.
The continued involvement of Force Reconnaissance Marines in Operation Harvest Red post the Russian occupation is still denied by the US government.
Team Razor was declared 'Missing In Action' at the point of USMC withdrawal.
Their real fate was never revealed.
The End

Our forces were overwhelmed by the Chedaki. Had we convinced the Russians to withdraw their support, we might have stood a chance. We have lost the fight here in northern Chernarus and should withdraw to the central regions where so far the Chedaki have no influence.

The position of our forces has become untenable. Chedaki and Russian forces are closing in, so we have to be quick. There's a possible exfiltration point in the ruins of nearby village. After reaching it, we'll be able to report and wait for transport.

Most communication channels have collapsed. There is virtually no intel available and what we have is unreliable and confused. We do know there are OPFOR units everywhere and we are utterly surrounded...
Reach Exfiltration Point

Shit! Shit! Shit! Everything is fucked! The Russians are openly backing the Chedaki, totally blind to their atrocities. Maybe they don't want to see. It's all gone to hell! I still don't regret getting into this, but seeing all our efforts come nothing is like a knife in me. The people we lost. We have to regroup, take a breath, consolidate and figure out what the hell we do next.
EXFIL
Missing In Action
The Chedaki are being overtly backed by Russian 'peacekeepers'. The allied forces have been routed. We need to evacuate ASAP.

BLUFOR were overwhelmed by the Chedaki. Had we convinced the Russians to withdraw their support, we might have stood a chance. BLUFOR lost the fight here in northern Chernarus and should withdraw to the central regions where so far the Chedaki have no influence.
From your <marker name="BIS_start">current position</marker> move to <marker name="BIS_chalice">point Chalice</marker> for exfiltration.
Leave the area of operations ASAP.
Most communication channels have collapsed. There is no Intel available or it is unreliable and confused. OPFOR units are everywhere and we are surrounded.
No support available.
Lost somewhere in Chernarus...
Sure, what's up?
Weeks...
No problem.
Copy that. Let's go.
Cooper! Can I have a word?
I know you haven't had much downtime over the last couple of days...
Right, weeks. Anyway, I need one more thing before I let you stand down.
Since the Chedaki broke the NGOs have been screaming in my ear for access, for two days I've had it now.
Anyway, I've a got a stack of humanitarian aid workers coming arriving at the airstrip near Vybor this afternoon.
There are still a few Chedaki running around who won't give in so I want you up there to help me organize security, OK?
Captain Konecny is the official aid liaison officer, we're heading up now to meet him.
I'm gonna drive up via Pogorevka and collect a few more guys, but you can go straight on to Vybor if you prefer.
You're free to take any of the vehicles and we've got a helo on task for recon.
Let's just get up there ASAP, the last thing I need is an aid-worker massacre, OK?
Hi, Olegich, hello! What is it?
Christ Olegich, there's enough here to put these men away for life. This goes right to the top of the Russian Duma. We've gotta get this out to USEUCOM.
My god, is that what I think it is?
What did I say, men? Cooper, I'm so glad you came! We thought we're not gonna make it.
We found something pretty weird during the conquest!
Looks like a few Moscow guys secretly supported Chedaki... Deceiving their own government!
The whole fucking war was made up by a bunch of crazy idiots. Cooper, you gotta hand this over to the Amercians!
What's that?
Orel this is Razor, copy that. Thanks for keeping watch guys, over.
OK Razor we're leaving the base now. See you on the airfield. Out.
All clear from down here Razor, we're about half way to Pogorevka. Out.
How you doing Razor? My convoy's coming up on Pogorevka now.
Razor this is Orel, your helo is airborne and en route, over.
No problem Razor, we'll sing out if we see anything odd. Orel out.
Razor this Orel, looks pretty clear over. No contacts. Out.
Razor this is Orel, still no contacts. Orel out.
Razor this is Orel, it's all clear down there guys. Out.
Yeah right! The luck we've been having recently?
Oh I don't know? Things could've gone a lot worse...
Just when I thought we were out of here!
You got that right Scarlet. At least Robo's run out of jokes...
You wish, Dressler's still horny for intel. We could always find more...
Guess we'll have chance to ask them later. He he, look who came to say goodbye... Hey Stavovich!
Oh right, we don't even know where to begin! I mean maybe the native intel officers can help, but where do we start?
All right we're here. I guess all we gotta do now is wait for that ride home huh?
No! No more hiking!
Hello Coops! I've been looking for you. I've got one more mission for you before you leave.
A NAPA agent calling himself Olegich contacted us, he's demanding a meeting with Razor Team, he's on his way to a nearby rendezvous right now.
Lieutenant Marny says it could be important. You better head out there now. Olegich will be waiting on the crosroad a kilometer east of Krasnostav.
And don't worry Rodriguez, you can take any vehicle you like! Have fun.
World War III

The Russian show of force came sooner and with more severity than anyone had feared. No one believed the Russians would launch a nuclear weapon, the idea was always dismissed as beyond all reason. Humanity now stands on the brink of annihilation, or maybe we crossed the line already and just didn't realize.
行动中失踪
Hey marine, the war may be over, but you still had a job to do. You can't just wander off!
When Russian troops were forced across the border and out of Chernarussian territory their government misinterpreted the situation as a direct and serious threat on its integrity.
The Commander of Zagorski Military District was granted permission to use tactical nuclear weapons to eradicate the supposed American/Chernarussian invasion and launch a counter-offensive.
In the following conflict, conspirators managed to hide all evidence connecting ChDKZ personnel to the Moscow bombing.
The truth remains buried in the ashes.
Team Razor was declared 'Missing In Action' and their real fate was never revealed.
The End

We ran an excellent campaign against the Chedaki. Their command structure is in ruins, we've severed their means of supply, their strongest units are destroyed, their ordnance, materiel and bases have been seized. Though we know the Russians were lured here by conspiracy, we could not convince them of it and had to force them out by other means. It might not have been the most politically acceptable solution, but we've achieved our objectives and Chernarus is whole again.
The airport near Vybor must be secured in order to allow humanitarian aid to be distributed evenly. Get to the airport, report to Cpt. Mitrovica, and assist him in securing the area.

Russia is enraged about the situation inside Chernarus, claiming US forces are illegally acting inside its traditional sphere of influence. Thanks to the lack of evidence, the UN member states are split over the entire conflict. Some support Russian action, but most are vehemently opposed. Regardless of the political storm, the weather here in Chernarus is clearing. There is a worry that the Russians may return, but the eyes of the world are focused on the now-united country. Let Russia plan a show of force if it likes, the world will be ready and so will Chernarus.
Move to airport

I can't believe it's almost over. It feels like we've always been here. But it is nearly over. The Chedaki are screwed, broken beyond any hope of regrouping. Their Russian buddies are grumbling from across the border, but the world is behind Chernarus now. The people of this country are united and nobody wants to see further conflict. It's a shame we couldn't convince the Russians that they were really victims in this too, that they were manipulated into a fight, because now they're suffering for it. Militarily and politically. Ah well, I don't feel too sorry for them!
AIRPORT
Revelation
The Chedaki were defeated and we routed their Russian allies. Now we have to pacify the region.

BLUFOR triumphed, utterly destroying the Chedaki. The Russians could not be convinced of the Lopotev-Karelin conspiracy so BLUFOR were forced to engage them. However politically undesirable this solution was, it led to us achieving our objectives and freeing Chernarus. Razor must now secure important assets against surprise attacks from the few remaining Chedaki terrorists.
Join column callsign 'Longhorn' in <marker name="BIS_zelenoPos">Zelenogorsk</marker> and move to <marker name="BIS_airfieldPos">Vybor airport</marker>. Report to CDF Cpt. Mitrovica there.
Move to <marker name="BIS_airfieldPos">Vybor airoprt</marker> and secure it against terrorist attacks.
Russian forces withdrew from Chernarus, the Chedaki have transformed to an underground movement, but are under heavy pressure from CDF intelligence, USMC and local police.
1x Mi-8MT will be overseeing transport from the air.

Russia is enraged about the situation inside Chernarus, claiming US Forces are illegally acting inside its traditional sphere of influence. Thanks to the lack of evidence, the UN member states are split over the entire conflict. Some support Russian action, but most are vehemently opposed. Regardless of the political storm, the weather here in Chernarus is clearing. There is a worry that the Russians may return, but the eyes of the world are focused on the now-united country. Let Russia plan a show of force if it likes, the world will be ready and so will Chernarus.
In a free country again...
Meet NAPA agent

An agent of NAPA, Olegich, claims that he has some information for you about a conspiracy of 'ChDKZ' and some Russian officials. He wants to speak to Razor personally. Meet him on a <marker name="Olegich">crossroad</marker> between Zelenogorsk and Pulkovo.
MEET NAPA AGENT
Well I guess you've got what you wanted. But that's some flock you've got now Father... Think you can manage them all?
Oh really... How?
Hey, it wasn't just your blood, Prizrak.
Haha, it's just the begining my friend.
This country needs strong leadership, democracy, a return of old values. I am ready to give the country what it needs. We shed our blood for this country after all!
Yes, I know. [pause] Have another glass, my friend, before you leave.
Like it or not we cannot live like we used to. There must be big changes.
Whatever the cost...
To the future, my friend.
After their victory over the Russian task force, NAPA gained popularity and public support beyond expectations.
In the following months the communist insurgency collapsed, their leaders powerless in the face of a new pro-Western republic.
Some NAPA commanders became national folk heroes, while the mysterious NAPA figurehead Prizrak vanished altogether.
The respected and surprisingly well-connected priest Fyodor Kovalenko was elected prime minister of the Republic of Chernarus soon after the end of war.
Razor Team were flown back to the USS Khe Sanh and their involvement in the Chernarussian conflict post US withdrawal became a well-kept secret.
They never returned to Chernarus.
The US administration and Russian Duma both continue to deny any military connections to any the warring factions inside Chernarus.
In 2014 the last ethnic Russian family living near Krasnostav moved to Russian territory.
Persistant disregard for human rights inside the Republic of Chernarus led most UN countries to end their diplomatic ties with that government.
The End
After leading the guerillas to glorious victory, Razor team finally have a way out of Chernarus.
Newborn Republic
Sergeant Cooper, just a few words before you leave. I was uneasy when your countrymen arrived. Well to be honest I was enraged. I guess it's been part of some overall US global dominance plan eh?
Jokes aside, I sincerely appreciate your mediation efforts after the Russians left. It could have been worse.
Speaking of 'those in NAPA', you know Fyodor Kovalenko disappeared.
Prizrak.
The transport was ambushed.
But this is not your problem, Razor. Time to go home. We'll wash away the blood, lock up the criminals and execute the traitors... You got Akula, we will find Prizrak. He can't run forever...
Colonel, sir, that would be classified...
All in a day's work sir. I guess some of those in NAPA still want to start it all over again.
Sir?
I see. I thought your spooks were shipping him southwest after the talks in Zelenogorsk?
The Russian government withdrew its forces from Chernarus after receiving conclusive evidence that the Moscow bombing was orchestrated in Russia and executed by 'chedaki' personnel.
Based on an agreement between the Russian and American governments, all events post the US withdrawal were camouflaged as the 'mistakes of low-level commanders' and dismissed as 'border incidents'.
With the help of the Marines, the Chernarussian people were able to quell the local insurgency.
Chernarus is free and well on the road to peace and democracy.
National Party guerillas were successfuly disarmed and disbanded in a vigorous CDF campaign.
Most National Party radicals and commanders were arrested and brought to trial.
Chernarussian intelligence hunted Prizrak for years but he was never captured and his fate remains unknown.
The involvement of Force Reconnaisance Marines inside Chernarus during the Russian occupation remains classified at the highest level.
Both American and Russian governments continue to deny any connection to any of the warring factions inside Chernarus during the conflict.
The End
Total victory! The Russians have left, Chernarus is free again, Razor are going home.

Nightmare
CDF garrison on Utes island under attack!
Hey, that's us, Force Recon. Where's the special ops command?
Alright, let's find Shaftoe and report in. It's not far...
You gotta move to point Alaska, a half click west, your CO is there with Reaper Command.
Razor, come in! I know it's been a long night but you're nearly home.
I want you to RV with the main assault group outside Chernogorsk. Grid Ref 076121.
The route should be pretty clear now but stay alert. Battlemage out.
Copy that, Battlemage, Oscar Mike. Razor out.
Ah man, can't he send someone to pick us up? I'm beat!
Hey if it's all the same to you Baller I'd rather not.
So far so good huh? Looks like this one's going to plan.
You'll get used to it.
Hang in there guys, nearly there.
Plenty of units ashore. Could've been a lot worse huh?
I can't get Pusta out of my head. You guys seen shit like that before?
Copy that...
Yeah, we never have a problem getting into a country. It's getting out that's the bitch.
You believe this shit? Like to see his pudgy ass on a forced march. Out here all night in this shit...
Yeah, if that's all the Chedaki have got this is gonna be a walk in the park.
What? See what?
You guys see that?
Probably nothing, forget it.
胜利
Razor Team managed to reach Chernogorsk in time to get their special operations assignment.
Razor Team must move from Pik Kozlova to the outskirts of Chernogorsk. USMC forces have already pushed the ChDKZ inside the city, now the siege begins.
Get to Chernogorsk
Amphibious Assault
After the raid on Pusta, Razor move to the US bridgehead.

Following the invasion, ChDKZ (Chedaki) forces are fleeing to the capital of the province, <marker name="BIS_chernoPos">Chernogorsk</marker>. All USMC units are to regroup there and seize the city. Razor Team should move to that position ASAP.
You have no transport available, move on foot. Engage any Chedaki encountered.

Razor Team is to move from their <marker name="BIS_start">current position</marker> to <marker name="BIS_chernoPos">Chernogorsk</marker> through no-man's land. Report to Cpt. Shaftoe after reaching the <marker name="BIS_finish">field HQ</marker> near <marker name="BIS_chernoPos">Chernogorsk</marker>.
USMC forces are fighting the Chedaki at the beachhead. Some are resisting, but many Chedaki fled to <marker name="BIS_chernoPos">Chernogorsk</marker>.
No support available. Elements of the 27th MEU encountered may support you though.
The invasion has commenced...
Come on Robo, can't you be a little more... culturally sensitive?
Right! Everyone relax and focus. We're almost there.
So that's one week in Chernarus today, isn't it?
Is that all? Seems like we've been here a month. These people get more wacko by the day.
Fuck that! Any culture that says burn your neighbors over politics can get screwed.
Whatever...
Did you flunk high school or something? That whole American Civil War thing pass you by? Just can it.
Come on, Robo, you pedal like a grandma!
I can't believe it! I'm enjoying a bike ride in a warzone!
Watch me ride on those bumps!
Woohoo! Semper Fitness!
That's so silly...
That's it, Simmons, we won! You can't beat The Four Riders, face it!
Dismount and to the Osprey! We have work to do. See you, Sabre!
Cool! They made it! Unbelievable!
Good one, Razor!
You mean clown on an exercycle?!
I heard that, Kaminski!

OK, let's go.

OK, we'll wait.

Command menu contents
1: Move
The Move menu is used for more complex movement orders. You can set formation here, stop the unit or manage waypoints.
2: Target
This menu contains a list of all currently available targets that can be assigned to selected units.
3: Engage
The engage menu sets the combat behavior of the selected unit. You may prohibit fire, allow units to engage at will or have the unit control the surroundings.
4: Mount
This menu contains a list of all nearby vehicles the selected unit can board.
5: Status
The Status menu is used to report your status. As a leader you can also ask others about their status via 'Report Status' selection.
6: Action
Here you'll find a list of actions for the selected unit. These actions are the same as those displayed in unit's Action Menu.
7: Combat Mode
You can control a unit's behavior from this menu. You can switch Safe or Combat states and set a unit's stance.
8: Formation
You can control group formation from this menu.
9: Team
This menu serves to divide the group into smaller teams to ensure the swift control of multiple units.
0: Reply
All radio communications are found in this section.
